body:
The latest brand that we’re highlighting in our guide series is Filorga – an innovative skincare brand. The brand is available in over 70 countries, present in 10,000 medical practices and sold through 8,000 sales points. The Filorga skincare brand has 18 products that are formulated to treat a variety of skincare concerns and issues. This core collection of product ranges from everyday products like cleansers and serums to treatments like masks.

What makes Filorga stand out from the crowd is its anti-ageing solutions that are designed for both medical professionals and use by the general public. The history of Filorga dates back to the 1970s, when its founder Dr Tordjman started to conduct his research into the skin’s ageing process. Filorga would eventually obtain a patent for its NCTF technology, an innovative solution that works by slowing down the aging process and correcting imperfections on your skin.

‍

‍

At the beginning, the Filorga Labroatoires were producing skincare products that were designed for professional use and treatments, such as fruit acid peels and hyaluronic acid injections. These products and treatments became popular within the fields of dermatology and aesthetic medicine.

After the success of its professional line, Filorga launched its first range of products for at-home use in 2007. The Medi-Cosmetique line is non-invasive, while still providing an effective skincare solution. These products work to eliminate fine lines and wrinkles, while restoring your skin’s brightness, strength, and density. It gives your skin a radiant glow and clears your complexion by removing imperfections and signs of aging.

‍

Five fun facts about Filorga Skincare

‍
Before we jump into the rest of our guide about everything you need to know about the French skincare brand, Filorga, we’re sharing five fun facts to get us started.

‍
1. Every Filorga product is 100% paraben free and clinically tested.

‍
2. The Filorga products are made using the brand’s world-famous HA + NCEF ingredient (formally NCTF) that is made using a blend of hyaluronic acid and a mixture of 12 vitamins, 23 amino acids, 6 minerals, 6 co-enzymes, 5 nucleic, and 2 antioxidants to improve your skin’s health.

‍
3. The brand’s signature HA + NCFT (now known as the NCEF) formula began its life as an injectable treatment is now available in salons as a treatment similar to Botox.

‍
4. Filorga uses chromosphere technology, which allows each of the molecules in the HA + NCEF to be small enough to penetrate into the layers of your skin.

‍
5. What makes Filorga skincare exciting is its expertise in a wild range of fields – from dermatology and biology to aesthetic medicine and cosmetology. The brand is able to offer products that work for all skin types, including tackling age-related skin concerns.

‍

Meet Filorga

‍
Filorga is a brand that describes itself as having “unique DNA directly inspired by aesthetic medicine…at the heart of Filorga, a passionate aesthetic doctor”. The brand began in 1978 with Dr. Michel Tordjman, a French doctor with an interest in cell biology. After years of research, Tordjman created a unique injectable formula that works by acting on the key parameters of your skin. The original Laboratories Filorga brand was born from this passion for developing products that have unique benefits and are intended for everyday use.

‍
Dr. Tordjman is considered by some to be the world’s greatest specialist in aesthetic medicine, leading to the popularity of Laboratories Filorga. He had a goal of creating a range of products that were formulated using hyaluronic acid, helping to extend the active ingredients used in the injectables. These revolutionary skincare products have an unparalleled formula.

‍

‍
Filorga has taken the same active ingredients that were used in the brand’s injectables and extended it to topical use. The brand’s signature NCEF active ingredient is made up of 50 components, including amino acids, coenzymes, antioxidants, minerals, and vitamins. What makes the NCEF unique is its anti-aging performance, including providing key cosmetic benefits that improve the appearance and quality of your skin.

‍
In 2007, the brand expanded to include the creation of MEDI-COSMETIQUE, a range of anti-ageing products with a revolutionary formula that is based on the NCEF active ingredient. NCEF took the active ingredients from their injections and made them available as part of the brand’s products for public use.

‍
Since its launch, the brand has expanded to include more than fifty cosmetic products that share the brand’s unique philosophy. They combine clinically proven and optimal ingredients that are visibly effective within 7 days.

‍
The Filorga brand has now expanded to more than 70 countries around the world, including more than 10,000 medical practices.

‍

The growth and expansion of Filorga

‍
The easiest way to look at the fascinating innovation of Filorga is to create a timeline of the brand’s success and development. In 1978, Tordjman was a cellular biologist who began to focus his research on cellular rejuvenation through mesotherapy. His products hit the market long before Botox became a success, using his innovative NCTF solution that acts on the 6 key parameters of skin quality. These early products targeted hydration, firmness, wrinkles, radiance, evenness, and pores. At the beginning, these anti-ageing mesotherapy injections were strictly used by trained professionals.

‍
The original NCTF formula has now evolved into the NCEF compound that profounds your skin’s penetration.
In 2000, Laboratoires Filorga launched GLYKOPEEL, a collection of anti-ageing glycolic acid peels that are used by doctors to help rejuvenate your skin and improve its overall condition. 2007 saw the biggest change for the brand when it launched their MEDI-COSMETIQUE range for use by the general public, inspired by their original aesthetic medicine. Products have gradually launched over time, including the brand’s iconic and best-selling Meso-Mask and Optim-eyes treatments.

‍

‍
In 2009, the brand launched its aesthetic medicine, X-HA3, a range of injectable products that could combat deep lines and restore volume to your skin. Fast forward to 2014 and Filorga renewed its range of peels by introducing the TIME, BRIGHT, AND LIGHT peels. These products were the first made-to-measure superficial peels with gluconolactone to hit the market, enhancing the tolerance of even sensitive skin.

‍
By 2016, the ART-FILLER range was developed by the aesthetic medicine branch of the company. These products were developed and created using one of the few global production units that could produce injectable hyaluronic acid-based products. It marked the start of a new generation of fillers, compromising of4 injectable products that could be used by aesthetic doctors as an adaptable methods to fill wrinkles.

‍
The following year, Filorga’s MEDI-COSMETIQUE range became the leading anti-ageing range stocks in pharmacies and parapharmacies in France. In 2018, Filorga’s aesthetic medicine branch was renamed FILL MED.

‍
If you’re in the market for investing in anti-aging skincare products, look no further than this innovative French brand. Filorga is an industry-leader and has been responsible for most of the evolution that we’ve seen in the anti-aging industry. It’s never too early to start thinking about preventing premature ageing and Filorga is unique with its professional and everyday use products.

‍
What do you think of anti-aging brands like Filorga? Are you interested in adding it to your skincare routine? Let us know in the comments below!

‍

The brand is available in over 70 countries, present in 10,000 medical practices and sold through 8,000 sales points. The Filorga skincare brand has 18 products that are formulated to treat a variety of skincare concerns and issues. This core collection of product ranges from everyday products like cleansers and serums to treatments like masks.

body:
Seventy One Percent runs with the tagline that “70% of the earth is water, 70% of our body is water, 1% for the planet”.  Seventy One is a natural and clean beauty brand that focuses on sun protection. It offers 80-100% natural formulas that are cruelty-free and made in France. This brand was “born from the love of the French wave”.  Seventy One Percent are surfers who are passionate about nature and sensations – meeting the expectations of all sun, ocean, and nature lovers.

‍

‍

This brand is one that doesn’t believe the ‘Made in France’ label is a fad, but rather a deep conviction. Seventy One puts its love of the planet and our environment at the forefront, which is why it’s committed to not testing on animals. The brand describes their products as “respectful of man and of this environment which is dear to us”. Like most clean beauty brands, Seventy One is transparent about the information involving their formulas to make it accessible to everyone.

‍
What makes Seventy One unique is that it’s “thought by surfers, built for everyone”. The focus on sun protection is as a result of the surfer background of the brand, which they point to as more of a lifestyle than a sport. Along with protecting our skin, Seventy One focuses on protecting our planet and the world around us.

‍
If you’ve landed on this article, the chances are that you’re considering purchasing something from Seventy One or you want to find out more about this clean beauty brand. We’re taking a deep dive into the world of Seventy One, looking at the philosophy of the brand and its environmentally friendly products. Read on to find out everything you need to know about this innovative beauty brand that focuses on sun protection.

About Seventy One Percent

‍
The name ‘Seventy One Percent’ comes from the idea that 70% of water on the planet, 70% of water in our body, and the fact that 1% of profits are donated directly to the Vision du Monde charity. This clean beauty brand bases its value on positive energy, action, honesty, and doing the right thing.

‍
Seventy One Percent has designed a range of sun-care cosmetic and skincare products that are made to meet the needs of the surfing community. It offers the protection that you need, while respecting the environment that is beloved by every surfer.

‍
The brand was born in 2009 after two friends reunited over their love of surfing. Since its launch, their products have been made in France to meet the needs of the surfing community, while protecting and respecting the world around us.

‍
Seventy One Percent focuses its efforts on creating efficient and environmentally-responsible products that aren’t full of superfluous marketing promises. Transparency is at the heart of what the brand does, opening up the industry and their product to their community.

‍

About The Seventy One Percent Product Range

‍
Inspired by the surfing community, Seventy One Percent aims to develop sun-protection products that are suitable for all skin types. Their formulas use high-quality ingredients that deliver proven performance, while respecting both the consumer and the planet. The brand works in harmony with nature, creating careful formulas and creams that meet their ecological and human values.

‍
While their products are made in French laboratories, the brand looks across the world for the latest research to fuel their innovation and development.

The Most Popular Seventy One Percent Products

‍
The Seventy One Percent product range focuses on face and body products that offer ultra-protection for your skin, fuelled by organic ingredients and mineral filters. The brand has a number of cream, stick, and spray SPF products available, so that you’re guaranteed to find one that works for your skin type.

‍

‍
One of the best-selling products by the brand is their Eco Sun Spray that offers SPF 50+ Invisible. The Eco Sun formula is available in a spray and cream formula, offering SPF 50+ with a water resistant formula that is made using 100% mineral filters. This sunscreen can offer protection for you and everyone in your family, young and old. It acts as a shield against UVA and UVB rays, using a blend of three vegetable oils to protect and strengthen your skin. This product has a vanilla flower fragrance that will make it easy to apply your sunscreen every day.

‍
Another product worth mentioning is the Dry Sun Oil, which offers SPF30 for your face, body, and hair. It offers sun protection without compromising on pleasure. Its water resistant formula is 80% natural and offers all-in-one protection for everything from your hair to face. This product protects your skin from UVA and UVB rays, with its golden formula giving your skin a natural satin shine, leaving behind a velvety touch on your skin.

‍

‍
The Dry Sun Oil offers a dreamy scent and zero greasy film for non-sticky protection that helps your fan develop a natural tan without suffering from sun damage. This formula is dermatologically tested with a scent that will remind you of your last tropical holiday. It includes aloe vera that helps to soothe your skin after a day in the sun.

‍

‍
The Original Sun Stick is a roll-on deodorant style sun protector that offers SPF 50+ with a very water resistant formula. It offers a broad spectrum of protection, including UVA and UVB, while being made with 87% natural ingredients. This product is specially formulated to use on sensitive areas of your face, including active ingredients that protect your skin from exposure to environmental factors.
Another part of the Seventy One Percent range is care and recovery products that hydrate your skin and offer support from sports recovery and muscle pain. These technical and eco-friendly cosmetic products work for all seasons and conditions, even if you’re interested in extreme sports.

‍

‍
Second Skin is a repairing balm that contains fermented papaya extract and 100% natural active ingredients. This multi-purpose balm is designed for athletes, inspired by the product used by Australian surfers. It protects your skin from the friction caused during long surfing sessions, preventing sun damage, while also irritating irritated lips and soothing insect bites.

‍

‍
Urban Feel Good is a multi-protector SPF30 that is an ultra-moisturizing fluid with anti-pollution and blue light protection. It helps restore your skin’s radiance by rehydrating and plumping your skin to protect, repair, and prevent sun damage. It’s fuelled by probiotics that are activated in the formula to strengthen and protect your skin.

‍

‍
Wipe Out is a relaxing artic post-action relaxing gel that uses a 98% natural formula. It’s another product that is designed for athletes and works to relieve aching joints and muscles using a blend of essential oils and proven active ingredients. You’ll find arnica, lemon eucalyptus, turmeric root, wintergreen, menthol, and tea tree oil amongst the ingredients list.

‍
You don’t need to be a surfer to enjoy these innovative sun-protection products. There is nothing more important than looking after your skin and preventing sun damage, which can lead to everything from premature aging to skin cancer. While we often think about serums and traditional makeup products, your SPF is the most important product in your routine.

‍
What we love about Seventy One Percent is that it’s taken its inspiration from the world of surfers and brought the need for ultra-sun protection to the masses. Even if you’re not hitting the waves at the beach, you want to make sure that you’re protecting your skin and using at least an SPF30 on a daily basis. Even if its gloomy outside, you need to be wearing an SPF to protect your skin. Seventy One Percent has made natural formulas that are kind to our skin and the world around us.

‍
You can explore the full Seventy One Percent product range here.

‍
What do you think of this innovative surfer skincare brand? Do you know the importance of wearing sun-protection every day? Let us know your thoughts in the comments below!

‍

This brand was “born from the love of the French wave”. Seventy One Percent are surfers who are passionate about nature and sensations – meeting the expectations of all sun, ocean, and nature lovers.

body:
One French brand that we’ve fallen head over heels in love with is Seasonly. It’s clean beauty that works. This brand was born out of a desire to change the way that women take care of their skin by giving them simple and clean products that are easy to use and fool-proof. Their skincare routines focus on streamlined products that pack a bunch. Seasonly want to do away with the three-foot long skincare routine and keep it simple with natural products that are effective, while respecting your skin.

‍

It’s the brand’s mission to create simple and 100% clean products that you could use with your eyes closed. These products are made for real women by women, designed to fit seamlessly into your daily routine. Seasonly’s philosophy is that ‘clean’ beauty is beauty that has found the balance between nature, pleasure, and science. Seasonly has been featured in publications like Vogue, Elle, and L’Officiel.

‍
Seasonly is a clean, vegan, and transformative skincare brand that wants to teach you how to take care of your skin in the easiest way possible. Their Skin Studios offer a 30-minute plumping, lifting, and illuminating facial gym treatment with the help of the expert hands of their facialists.

‍
If you’ve landed on this article, the chances are that you’re considering purchasing something from Seasonly or you want to find out more about this clean beauty brand. We’re taking a deep dive into the world of Seasonly, looking at the philosophy of the brand and its environmentally friendly products. Read on to find out everything you need to know about this innovative beauty brand that offers products “for the best and for the clean”.

‍

‍

Meet Seasonly

‍
Seasonly’s formulas are short and sweet, with traceable ingredients that are active and sourced ethically. As part of their environmental initiative, the brand uses recycled and recyclable packaging, with their natural cosmetics being manufactured in the brand’s laboratories to their precise charter, ensuring that the product includes the right number of preservatives.

‍
Like other ‘clean’ beauty brands, Seasonly has a “no list” of blacklisted ingredients that you will never see included in their formula list. The brand offers everything you need from cleaners to serums and lotions, along with face tools that can create a facial gym and give your skin the TLC it needs.

‍

‍

One of the unique points about Seasonaly is that it offers customoized skincare products that work not only for their specific skincare concern but the season (hence the name!) and the geographical location. Seasonly is one of the biggest players in the ‘natural’ beauty niche in France, giving customers an online experience that allows them to tailor their skincare product that works for exactly what you need.

‍
The mission of Seasonly is to make “clean beauty that works” and to change the way that women look after their skin by making it as simple as possible. Their ambition is to give you a skincare routine that you could do with your eyes closed and with the help of only a few products. Their skincare products are made for real women who don’t have time for a twenty-step skincare routine and who want effective products that work and are respectful for their skin.

Their accessible skincare products are designed for real women living real lives, customized to meet the needs of their specific skincare concerns. Some of their most popular treatments include anti-sagging, anti-wrinkle treatments, and light therapy technology.

‍

‍
Along with offering its personalised skincare, Seasonly also offers several treatments through different imitations across Paris and Bordeaux. These treatments are tailored to your specific skincare concerns and are also offered for groups, whether it’s for a bachelorette party or a girl’s day out. As a clean skincare brand, Seasonly also offers ‘baby and me’ skincare treatments.

‍
Although Seasonly promotes themselves as a women-driven brand, their products are unisex, and the brand offers a specific men’s facial in their institutions. These treatments are all at least 30 minutes long with a focus on reboosting your skin. Their facial care studios are inspired by the self-care spots that are popping up all over New York.

‍

Seasonsly’s Clean Beauty

‍
Seasonly call themselves “supporters of the fresh and the true”. They don’t think of ‘clean’ as just being a buzzword but instead as the “standard of tomorrow”. The brand promotes clean beauty as being a balance between nature, pleasure, and science. Seasonly works with short formulas and locally sourced, traceable active ingredients.

‍
As an environmentally conscious brand, Seasonly uses packaging that is recycled and recyclable. They manufacturer their products in their own laboratories, following their specific charter to ensure every product is up to their high-quality standards.

‍
Part of Seasonly’s work includes educating their community on what their skin needs and doesn’t need to keep it healthy. Like most clean and green beauty brands, Seasonly have a “no list” of ingredients that are banned from their production process.

‍

Beauty that is made to look like you

‍
Seasonly isn’t just a ‘clean’ beauty brand, it’s also an inclusive brand. They describe how “we don't want to invest in perfectly plastic mannequins, they don't look like us, and above all, they don't look like you”. The brand points to its community – to you – as being their muse. Their community are the ambassadors for their products – with their crow’s feet, redness, bumps, and wrinkles. Seasonly looks to their community for inspiration with a mission to create beauty that is made to look like you – like a real woman and not a photoshopped supermodel on the cover of a magazine.

‍
Education is a cornerstone in the philosophy of the brand. They allow their community to feed into their product creation, constantly sharing knowledge and organizing their ‘Skin Schools’ to help with brainstorming for future products. They also host ‘Green Talks’ with their community to discuss the challenges of tomorrow’s beauty industry, whether it’s with consumers, scientists, and artists.

‍

The Gym Treatment Studio

‍
Your skin deserves a good workout. While a moisturizer can do wonders, it can’t do everything for you. Seasonly have created their ‘gym treatment studio’, taking inspiration from the self-care spots that are popping up all over New York for women. The ‘Gym Care Studio’ is a 30-minute massage that is designed to brighten your day – and your skin. It’s a short 30-minute treatment that can make all the different to your skin by giving it a much-needed reboost.

‍
This treatment is offered at Seasonly’s six different studios across Europe. The Gym Treatment focuses on removing makeup, stretching the facial muscles and gradually warming up the face using a series of lifting techniques. These techniques include rolling masseters and nasolabial folds. The facialist will knead frown lines and work on each eyebrow to smooth and lift the skin around your brows. The lifting techniques will focus on the pyramidal muscle and forehead, before smoothing and applying a moisturizer routine before finishing with a quartz roller.

‍

‍
It’s not just women who can benefit from this innovative treatment – it’s also available for men as a 30-minute boot camp to help rejuvenate your skin’s radiance and firmness.

‍
Along with the Gym Treatment, Seasonly’s portfolio of treatments include everything from a Korean Lift to their ‘Glow and Friends Duo’ and ‘Summer Plumpy’ treatment. These different treatments can be tailored to the needs of every client, whether you’re young or old, or have sensitive or oily skin. The six institutes across Paris and Bordeaux are amongst the most famous aspect of the brand, with Seasonly’s Parisian institutes offering the Korean Lift.

‍
Seasonly is clean beauty that works – with a mission to change the beauty industry from within and to make it reflect the real woman. There’s no point seeing beauty products in people who are airbrushed and photoshopped to perfection. Instead of having a celebrity as their muse, Seasonly looks to its community for inspiration. We love this innovation and its focus on creating beauty products that reflect real women – with all their crow’s feet, wrinkles, and acne.

‍
With the help of Seasonly, you can ditch your k-beauty style 20-step skincare routine a and downsize it to a streamline skincare routine that you can do with your eyes closed. Consistency and healthy ingredients are the secret to glowing skin – and that’s exactly what you’ll get with Seasonly.

‍
What do you think of brands like Seasonly that market themselves towards ‘real’ women? Are you interested in green beauty brands like Seasonly? Let us know in the comments below!

‍

This brand was born out of a desire to change the way that women take care of their skin by giving them simple and clean products that are easy to use and fool-proof. Their skincare routines focus on streamlined products that pack a bunch. Seasonly want to do away with the three-foot long skincare routine and keep it simple with natural products that are effective, while respecting your skin.
meta-description: Seasonly is a clean, vegan, and transformative skincare brand that wants to teach you how to take care of your skin in the easiest way possible.
meta-title: Seasonly – The Vegan French Skincare Brand
name: Seasonly

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
body:
If you’re looking for a chic Parisian skincare brand, look no further than Oh My Cream – a next-generation beauty boutique. Oh My Cream describes itself as “the alternative beauty concept store that takes care of you and your skin”. What we love about this beauty brand is its focus on using basic steps that can make a real different to your daily beauty routine.

‍
The concept of Oh My Cream is simple. It’s based on a desire to combine a selection of clean and efficient brands with tailor-made and expert advice, all carried by an innovative website and intimate boutique shops.

‍
The Oh My Cream skincare range is a collection of basic products that are designed to keep your skin looking pretty and feeling healthy. These products are tailored to give your skin exactly what it deserves to keep it looking fresh.

‍
If you’ve landed on this article, the chances are that you’re considering purchasing something from Oh My Cream or you want to find out more about the brand. We’re taking a deep dive into the world of Oh My Cream, looking at the philosophy of the brand and its next-generation mentality. Read on to find out everything you need to know about this innovative beauty brand.

‍

How Oh My Cream selects their beauty products

‍
When it comes to choosing which products to stock, Oh My Cream focuses on looking at the ingredients within the formula. Before the products appear on their shelves, they have to meet the brand’s strict criteria, which also focuses on the environmental impact and efficiency of the product.
Here are some of the products that you can find in Oh My Cream boutiques:

‍
1. Face, body, and hair treatments

The brand focuses on selecting treatments that are powered by active ingredients that are kind to your skin and body.

‍
2. Food supplements and superfoods

When Oh My Cream are selecting which supplements to stock, the brand consults a team of experts, including pharmacists and naturopaths to select the best brands that are 100% safe.

‍
3. Beauty tools and equipment

Whether it’s massage tools, LED-powered equipment, or even ultrasounds, Oh My Cream only stocks beauty tools that deliver proven skin benefits.

‍
The founding principle for choosing which products to stock is ‘clean above all else’. The brand advocates for absolute transparency, giving its community the knowledge and tools that it needs to make an informed decision on which products to use.

‍
Oh My Cream is built on the philosophy and values of its founder, Juliette – authenticity, benevolence, and humility. The brand is committed to throwing back the curtains and showing what the brand is like behind the scenes, with a commitment to transparency.

‍
The Oh My Cream team has a passion for beauty at the heart of everything it does. It aims at being innovative, using experts and the latest research to develop the brand’s strength and provide the must-have up-and-coming products of the future.

‍

The philosophy of Oh My Cream

‍
One of the things that we love about Oh My Cream is that it’s a 100% female company. While this happened by accident, we think it proves the power of female entrepreneurship to bring innovation to the beauty industry. While the brand works with male consultants through their agencies, who support their daily work, the core team is all women.

‍
As a female-founded business, Oh My Cream is a futuristic brand that is committed to supporting its employees. It offers everything from flexible maternity leave to organizing working hours in a way that suits the lifestyle and commitments of its employees. As a next-generation beauty brand, Oh My Cream allows its employees to work flexibly using teleworking.

‍

The boutique’s environmental efforts

‍
Oh My Cream works with a number of committed partners who are on the same journey as them and same the same philosophy of inclusion and environmental protection.

‍
A number of the brands that the boutique carries reflects the sustainability and environmental philosophy behind Oh My Cream. Ren Skincare, one of the boutique’s brands, has a zero-waste goal that it hopes to hit this year with fully recyclable packaging, including refillable bottles and packaging made using plastic collected from the sea and beaches.

‍
The brand Patyka also packages its products in recycled cardboard, without using glue and vegetable ink for reduce environmental damage. Oskia, another brand offered by the boutique, uses bio-sourced plastic packs that are made using cane sugar. Other brands carried at the boutique, including Huilettes and Joelle Ciocco, promote sustainability by using short supply chains and sourcing directly from small and independent producers.

‍

‍
Oh My Cream has a logistic workshop in Ile-de-France, where your order will be packaged up and shipped. The workshop uses a number of initiatives to help limit the brand’s impact on the environment.

‍
The on-site team at the workshop sort through the waste and ensure that it is properly recycled. Anything that can be reconditioned and recycled is upgraded. Some of the paper is used to feed paper mills, while leftover cardboard is reused by cardboard makers. Other types of waste, including wood, is reused in an appropriate manner. The boxes that arrive for their partner brands are reused to ship the merchandise to the boutiques to reduce waste. Single used plastic is minimised as much as possible to reduce the boutique’s environmental footprint.

‍
Another method of avoiding unnecessary waste is by using a computer system that manages the expiration dates of products to prevent waste. There is only one or two restocks of the brand’s Parisian boutiques to limit the carbon impact of these deliveries.

‍
The logistics workshop is lit using an LED system and motion detectors to keep electrical consumption at a minimal, with the on-site team being trained on consumption of consumables like electricity.

‍

Oh My Cream Skincare

‍
The mission of Oh My Cream Skincare is to democratize high-quality skincare and make it available at an affordable price point. The brand’s in-house skincare label is made in France, along with both the formula and packaging. On the environmental front, the brand uses glass packaging where possible and practical to do so, as well as recyclable plastic packs. The purpose of Oh My Cream is to create an increasingly eco-friendly beauty brand that takes steps everyday to improve its environmental footprint.

‍
Within their boutiques, Oh My Cream works to minimize waste, including by using soft terrycloth linen. Their future plans include swapping out their cotton linen to bamboo, which uses less water and has a longer lifespan. The brand has set out a zero-paper goal that it wants to achieve by 2022.

‍
Philanthropy is also at the heart of what Oh My Cream does. The brand makes regular shipments of products to associations in need, particularly those that support isolated mothers and their children. Items that are purchased for marketing shoots and items that can’t be reused are donated to people in need. Anything that can be given a new home – whether it’s office furniture or leftover food from an event – is donated to a needy cause.

‍
Oh My Cream is a relatively young start-up at only 5-years-old but it’s already making waves within the Parisian beauty scene. What we love about it is its sustainability mission and its commitment to choosing beauty brands that meet its philosophy and environmental efforts. If you’re looking for a new private label skincare brand or a new boutique to visit, look no further than Oh My Cream. This female-founded beauty brand is one of the most exciting ones on the market and one that we’re looking forward to watching grow and expand in the years to come.

‍
Have you ever heard of Oh My Cream? Are you going to check-out their boutique or skincare brand? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
brand-summary: If you’re looking for a chic Parisian skincare brand, look no further than Oh My Cream – a next-generation beauty boutique. Oh My Cream describes itself as “the alternative beauty concept store that takes care of you and your skin”. What we love about this beauty brand is its focus on using basic steps that can make a real different to your daily beauty routine.

body:
Odacite is a vegan and cruelty-free skincare brand that we think everyone should now about. This brand tests their products on real people and not available, while being product to carry a PETA certificate. This California-based brand is made with French savoir faire. It marries the best of two worlds: result-driven French skincare the green California revolution, promoting environmental sustainability. Odacite is efficacy plus purity to produce the skincare products of the future.

‍
The brand does not use fillers, parabens, nanoparticles, synthetic perfumes, or dyes in its formulas. Odacite promotes itself using the hashtag #ToHealthAndBeauty – encapsulating the ethics and philosophy of this next-generation skincare brand. These products are made in California with GMO-free formulas. Odacite promotes itself as “the art of clean beauty” that unites research and the expertise of French skincare with Californian living to create a modern skincare product.

‍

‍
If you’ve landed on this article, the chances are that you’re considering purchasing something from Odacite or you want to find out more about the brand. We’re taking a deep dive into the world of Odacite, looking at the philosophy of the brand and its environmentally friendly products. Read on to find out everything you need to know about this innovative beauty brand.

About Odacite

‍
Odacite was founded by Valerie Grandury, who was born and raised in Paris before moving to Los Angles. She’s gone from fighting cancer to fighting wrinkles. Her journey within the beauty industry started when she was diagnosed with breast cancer, which acted as a wakeup call.

‍
Valerie changed everything about her life, quitting her job and going back to school to become a health and wellness coach before embarking on a journey to remove toxins from her life.

‍

‍
When it came to launching her skincare brand, Valerie wanted formulas that didn’t sacrifice on performance. Her goal was to create efficient and pure formulas that delivered results. Unable to find this style of skincare product, Valerie started to blend custom-made skincare for herself and private clients. Word about her products spread fast, with demand growing, leading to the launch of Odacite.

‍
The name Odacite is a play on the French word ‘Audacity’, reflecting how the brand brings together the best of Californian and French living to create a sustainable and toxin-free skincare brand.

‍
Topanga is the birthplace and inspiration behind Odacite. It’s the bohemian-chic region of Los Angeles and forms the bridge between Los Angeles and Malibu. Topanga Canyon captivates your spirit and will make you fall back in love with nature. The beauty and harmony that marry at Topanga provide the inspiration for Odacite’s products, whether it’s the subtle scent of wild sage or the tender night blooming jasmine.

‍
Odacite was launched in 2009 with a collection of pure plant ‘Serum Concentrates’ that are rich in skin-essential nutrients. These serums were designed to target a variety of common skincare problems, with the concentrated oils working with your cells to re-establish your skin’s equilibrium.

‍
Odacite focuses on rejuvenating, fortifying, protecting, and vitalising your skin using nourishing formulas. This female-owned business is one of the most exciting USA-based skincare brands that we’re closely watching as we head into the future. Odacite has appeared in publications like Vogue, Elle, InStyle, and Cosmopolitan.

‍

The ingredients used by Odacite

‍
As part of its mission, Odacite is committed to sourcing only the best ingredients to create their innovative skincare products. Its goal is to create effective skincare products that deliver proven results, without using toxins. The brand has travelled the global to find the highest-quality ingredients, including plant extracts and oils, to produce their next-generation formulas. Their products deliver ultimate potency and deliver absolute freshness and purity for your skin. Every Odacite product is cruelty-free and tested on real people, not animals.

‍
These ingredients are chosen to nourish your skin cells and heal and rejuvenate your skin. Odacite combines all-natural ingredients to create multi-purpose products that heal your skin, soften its texture, and tackle everything from blemishes to premature aging.

‍
These products work to rejuvenate, replenish, and rehydrate your skin. You can think of these skincare products as being nothing short of magic. This mix of natural ingredients are packed full of healthy active minerals, antioxidants, and skin-loving nutrients.

‍

‍
Odacite hand-selects potent botanicals that are organic, wild-crafted or grown without chemicals and far away from pollution. The brand only uses fresh, pure, and organic ingredients that give your skin the nourishment it needs to look healthy and glow from within.
Ingredients on the Odacite ban list include:

‍
• Fillers
• Preservatives
• Parabens
• Phenoxyethanol
• Nanoparticles
• Petrochemicals
• PEG
• Synthetic perfumes and dyes

‍
Freshness is a key part of Odacite’s formulas and creation. The brand believes that fresh ingredients are the key to the success of its formulas, using only the most potent and effective natural ingredients. The freshest formulas are found within the brand’s accurately named ‘Fresh Collection’. The products within this collection are formulated upon order and come with a ‘fresh by’ date, similar to the ‘best before’ date that you find on food.

‍
The brand’s ‘Private’ and ‘Pure Element’ collections are prepared fresh every day in small batches within Odacite’s Californian lab. The ‘Pure Elements’ collection is a unique range that is different in everything from its names to ingredients. There are currently 18 products in the collection, which includes everything from age-defying oils to youth serums and facial concentrations that soothe and rejuvenate your skin.

‍
By using natural ingredients, Odacite products are formulated for sensitive skin types, preventing the irritation that typically comes with products that contain harsh chemicals and irritants.

‍
The ‘Pure Elements’ collection also includes a combination of products that are designed to rejuvenate your skin.

‍

The Odacite Product Range

‍
Odacite is a skincare brand that offers products that tackle a wide range of skin concerns. Their tailored formulas are focused on tackling six main concerns: age defying, hydration, firmness, sensitivity, radiance & glow, alone with oily-combination skin.

‍
You can find the Odacite product range in over 30 countries, showing the power of one woman’s mission to bring her therapeutic expertise to the beauty industry. The success of Odacite is due in no small part to its dedication and commitment to using cruelty-free and natural formulas, the kind that consumers are actively seeking out.

‍
Odacite is a skincare brand that goes back to basics by using natural ingredients, removing the harsh chemicals that we find in most beauty products, and which can irritate your skin. Some of the most beauty women in history have been known to use powerful natural ingredients. Cleopatra used Moringa Oil, while the geishas in Japan used Camelia oil to maintain their skin’s luminous glow. Odacite builds on these classic and skin-soothing benefits of natural ingredients, while giving them a contemporary twist.

‍
As we look to the future of the beauty industry, Odacite is one brand that we’re excited to be following. If you’re looking for an innovative brand that is kind to your skin and the world around us, look no further than Odacite. With tis inspiring origins story and its use of natural and sustainable ingredients, we can picture Odacite growing from strength to strength. As the ‘green beauty revolution’ continues, brands like Odacite are only going to become more popular.

‍
What do you think of Odacite and it’s natural formulas? Is it the kind of brand that you would shop with? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
brand-summary: Odacite is a vegan and cruelty-free skincare brand that we think everyone should now about. This brand tests their products on real people and not available, while being product to carry a PETA certificate. This California-based brand is made with French savoir faire. It marries the best of two worlds: result-driven French skincare the green California revolution, promoting environmental sustainability. Odacite is efficacy plus purity to produce the skincare products of the future.

body:
L’Occitane is one of the most recognisable beauty and skincare brands in the world. One of its best-selling products is its miniature hand creams, which you’ll find on every beauty editor’s must-have list. The brand is synonymous with its Provence origins and its focus on the idea of taking inspiration from the world around us. While L’Occitane is a brand with a rich heritage, it’s also got its eyes fixed on the future with a commitment to sustainability and protecting our natural environment.

‍
If you’ve stumbled onto this guide, it’s likely that you’re thinking of making a purchase from L’Occitane or that you want to get the know the brand better. We’re taking a deep dive into the world of all things L’Occitane to find out more about what makes it so popular and a household name across the world.

‍

‍
Spoiler alert: L’Occitane is one brand that you’re going to fall in love with. Grab your credit card and be ready to make a few impulse purchases!

‍
Read on to find out more about L’Occitane and what the brand stands for, along with its sustainability commitments. We’re focusing on the sustainability and ethical philosophy that makes the brand stand out from the crowd.

‍

The L’Occitane Story

‍
The story of L’Occitane begins in the markets of Provence, France. It began as a small truck and was founded by 23-year-old Olivier Baussan who began to distil rosemary essential oil to sell locally from the truck. He used his knowledge of plants to create natural products, including oils and soaps. Baussan took his inspiration from the Provenance countryside and the natural beauty of the world around us.

‍
The origin of L’Occitane continues to influence the brand’s development and story. It’s committed to showing off the very best of what Provence has to offer. Everything that L’Occitane does is to help preserve the natural environment that acted as the original inspiration behind the brand.

‍
L’Occitane’s philosophy is built on the idea that “nature matters, people matters” with sustainability and ethical supply chains at the heart of the brand’s production.

‍

L’Occitane ingredients

‍
When it comes to talking about a beauty brand, it’s only right to deep dive into the ingredients that they use. At L’Occitane, the brand is committed to using high-quality natural ingredients that are traceable. The brand uses over 200 different botanical ingredients, with a quarter of them being organically certified. They hand select their ingredients based on their effectiveness and the way they react with your skin.

‍
Every ingredient is used at its ideal concentration, practising natural ingredients wherever possible. Instead of using petrochemical-derived oils, the brand uses vegetable oils that work better with our skin. All of the ingredients used by L’Occitane are ethically sourced and chosen with care.

‍
L’Occitane is one brand that is involved from the ground level up, getting to know their raw ingredients and suppliers from the inside out. They’re actively involved in everything from the basic seed through to the finished formula and product.

‍
The brand works directly with over 130 French farmers and 10,000 pickers who are located everywhere from the lavender fields of Provence to the fields of Corsica to secure high-quality and sustainable ingredients.

‍

The four commitment pillars of L’Occitane

‍
L’Occitane has four commitment pillars that drive everything that the brand does. It sees nature as the model behind its brand, drawing inspiration and using it as a means of driving innovation. When choosing ingredients, L’Occitane focuses on its four pillars of traceability, sustainability, fairness, and quality.

‍
Traceability focuses on knowing exactly where the ingredients have come from. L’Occitane works with local producers wherever possible, in order to reduce and regulate their carbon footprint, while also helping to support local businesses and promote the social fabric of the Provence region. The brand gives priority to the small networks that bring added value to the producer and allow L’Occitane to fully trace the ingredient from being a seed to being in the finished formula.

‍
Sustainability is a focal point of the brand’s work. They’re committed to making no compromises when it comes to protecting endangered species or the communities that work with them. L’Occitane carry out effectiveness tests and experiment with combining ingredients that meet the cosmetic needs of the market.

‍

‍
Fairness is another pillar for L’Occitane. The brand is focused on building partnerships, including through multi-year contracts with its producers. L’Occitane guarantees its partners a minimum purchase volume and a fair price. Several of the brand’s suppliers for ingredients like shea butter, argan oil, and orange blossom floral water are fair trade approved. The brand also donates a percentage of the purchase price for these products towards local development projects.

‍
Quality is the fourth pillar for L’Occitane. They have a specific specification that all their ingredients and technical partners have to meet. Their key ingredients are primarily organically derived, guaranteeing the absence of chemical inputs. The harvesting of wild plants is overseen by the brand’s sustainable harvesting guidelines to help protect the integrity and habitat of such plants.

‍
Some of the main headlines of L’Occitane’s four pillars include that they have:
• 30 traceable ingredient supply chains with 50% organic certificated
• 80 partnerships with farmers
• 10,000 pickers working for L’Occitane across France

‍

L’Occitane’s sustainability work

‍
The brand launched a large-scale organic immortelle plantation programme in Corsica. This initiative focuses on respecting the environment with equality and fairness. The project brings together ten different Corsican growers and distillers, using organic farming methods and contracts that cover up to seven harvests to give these communities the stability that they need.

‍
Shea butter is one of the key ingredients for L’Occitane. The founder of L’Occitane, Olivier Baussan, discovered shea butter during a trip to Burkina Fason in 1980. It was the beginning of a joint sustainability partnership with the women in the community who produced the shea butter. Since 2015, L’Occitane have been developing projects that focus on protecting the shea tea and reducing the environmental impact of the production of shea butter, while maintaining the local skill base. Over 10,000 women are working within the local industry and sell their shea butter at a price point that is twice that of standard shea butter, thanks to these initiatives.

‍

L’Occitane’s six commitments for protecting our planet

‍
Another one of L’Occitane’s pledges focuses on six commitments for protecting our planet and treating people with respect.

‍
For respecting biodiversity, L’Occitane use only traceable and sustainability sourced ingredients wherever possible. They ensure that the plants are cultivated and harvest in a way that doesn’t harm the environment or surrounding biodiversity. They’ve also developed supply chains that help to protect local plant species. L’Occitane launched the first organic immortelle plantation in Corsica and have helped to bring almond trees back to Provence, while working to protect lavender production that has been under threat by climate change. L’Occitane has an ambitions aim to protect 1,000 species and varieties of plants by 2025.

‍
Supporting producers is the second pillar and focuses on the relationship between L’Occitane and its producers, which are based on trust and mutual respect. They have long-term and non-exclusive contracts with their producers, ensuring that they pair them a fair price and offer technical and financial support. L’Occitane aims to have a Fair-Trade relationship with all of their direct producers by 2025.

‍

‍
The third pledge is to reduce waste. It’s part of L’Occitane’s three Rs – recycle, reduce, and react – which focuses on the impact of plastic pollution. The brand offers a recycling service in most of their stores and have partnered with TerraCycle to tackle difficult-to-recycle packaging. They also offer refills and are striving to make their packaging as environmentally friendly as possible. The brand aims to ensure that 100% of their bottles are made using 100% recycled plastic by 2025, with 100% of their stores offering a recycling service.

‍
Commitment number four is for empowering women. L’Occitane firmly believes in the idea of gender equality and empowering women. Through their work in Burkina Faso, they are helping women to make their own shea butter as a way of gaining independence. The brand’s Foundation has helped these women to access everything from microcredits to literacy programmes and education for children. Every year, L’Occitane sell fund-raising products to promote women’s leadership. By 2025, the brand aims to be supporting 60,000 women in their socio-economic development.

‍
The fifth commitment is caring for sight. If you’ve ever seen a L’Occitane product, you’ll have notice that there is braille on the packaging and that they sell fundraising product to help fight preventable blindness. The brand partners with UNICEF and NGOs, along with working through their foundation, to support those who are blind or visually impaired. L’Occitane’s goal is to enable 10 million beneficiaries to have access to eye care within the next few years.

‍
The sixth and final pillar of L’Occitane’s philosophy is about celebrating craftsmanship. The brand recognises that artisanal skill is disappearing and that it is more important than ever. L’Occitane works with local craftsmen to showcase their talents and work with them to create exclusive products that celebrate their traditional artisanal skills. The brand wants to continue to support artisans and share their skills and stories with other.

‍
What do you think of L’Occitane? Is it a beauty brand that you’re interested in? Does its sustainability mission make you more likely to purchase from them? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
brand-summary: L’Occitane is one of the most recognisable beauty and skincare brands in the world. One of its best-selling products is its miniature hand creams, which you’ll find on every beauty editor’s must-have list. The brand is synonymous with its Provence origins and its focus on the idea of taking inspiration from the world around us. While L’Occitane is a brand with a rich heritage, it’s also got its eyes fixed on the future with a commitment to sustainability and protecting our natural environment.

body:
Meet the French clean beauty brand that everyone is talking about - and we mean everyone. Les Huilettes has been featured everywhere from Elle to Vogue and Grazia, amongst other publications. It focuses on feel-good beauty that is kind to your skin and the world around us, putting authenticity, integrity and sensorially at the heart of the brand. This beauty promotes the idea of green and natural beauty, with 100% organic and vegan formulas. These formulas are made using the purest essential oils and virgin vegetable oils that are handpicked for their efficiency and sensorially.

‍

‍

Les Huilettes is the brainchild of two long-term friends, Claire and Pascale. Pascale is a Doctor of Pharmacy and has a degree in Aromatherapy, with a background in developing cosmetic formulas for luxury brands. Claire is a marketing and PR executive who has worked with luxury brands in the beauty and food industries. These friends have worked together to create an effective range of natural skincare products that nourish your skin.

‍
What we love about Les Huilettes is that it’s a sustainability-focused brand that makes a conscious effort to develop their formulas using high-quality and organic ingredients that are locally sourced. The sustainability mission includes eco-designed packaging, glass bottles, and avoiding the use of excessive packaging and plastic.

‍
The mission of Les Huilettes is to bring emotion back into our beauty rituals, suspending time to allow a moment for yourself with a self-care routine. Les Huilettes uses effective yet ultra-clean formulas that use the incredible synergy of essential oils.

‍

‍
If you’ve landed on this article, the chances are that you’re considering purchasing something from Les Huilettes or you want to find out more about the brand. We’re taking a deep dive into the world of Les Huilettes, looking at the philosophy of the brand and its environmentally friendly products. Read on to find out everything you need to know about this innovative beauty brand.

What you need to know about Les Huilettes

‍
Les Huilettes was launched in 2017 at Colette, Huilettes. The brand has quickly expanded and is available in household names like Bon Marché, Printemps, Oh My Cream and in some pharmacies across France.

‍
This beauty brand is based on authenticity, commitment and the bringing the heart back into our beauty routines. Les Huilettes offers a new approach to skincare, using 100% active organic and unique formulas that are derived from high-quality ingredients that are hand-selected for their effectiveness and sensoriality.

‍
Pascale works in her Parisian laboratory to choose the natural active ingredients that give the most promising skin benefits. She sources the ingredients from high-quality partners and producers, focusing on organic farming and eco-friendly practices. Every ingredient is picked for its intrinsic qualities, including everything from its colour to odour.

‍
What makes Les Huilettes different from other natural skincare brands is its focus on concentrating the benefits of the skin and the mind to create nourishing skin-loving products.

‍

‍
When you get your hands on a Les Huilettes product, it’s like a moment suspended in time. The brand wants you to treat your skincare routine as an opportunity to ‘inhale good vibes, exhale well-being’ and embrace a desire to enjoy life to the fullest while feeling good. Wellness is at the heart of the brand, promoting the idea of your skincare being a form of self-care.

‍
Les Huilettes focuses on using naturally effective ingredients, including botanically and biochemically defined essential oils, cold-pressed, unrefined, and unprocessed plant oils, butters, waxes. These natural ingredients are rich in unsaturated and unsaponifiable fatty acids and provide skin-loving benefits. The brand turns to nature to obtain high-quality ingredients that are highly traceable and exceptional for their formulas.

‍

Les Huilettes green mission

‍
Les Huilettes have taken their sustainability mission to the next level by partnering with Up2green on reforestation projects, which help to reduce CO2 emissions and provide local communities and families with a direct income from the fruit bearing trees that they plant.

‍
The brand is certified COSMOS ORGANIC by Ecocert Greenlife, according to the COSMOS standards and is vegan register by the Vegan Society.

‍
Every Les Huilettes product is made in small batches in France to guarantee maximum freshness of the active ingredients within the formula. These products are tested in independent laboratories, including cutaneous and ophthalmic tolerance tests and efficiency tests under dermatological and ophthalmological control.

‍

‍
Les Huilettes uses high-quality ingredients and is free of controversial ingredients, including palm oil and beeswax.

‍
The brand’s products are 100% local and made in France using formulas that are created in an integrated laboratory in Suresnes in the Paris region. The production and packaging all occur within France, ranging from Nice to Lyon.

‍
You’ll find the ‘Powered by Region Paris’ label on these products, which supports and accompanies small and medium-size businesses that are aiming to grow both nationally and internationally. It’s part of a network of over 3,000companies that contribute to the economic dynamism of the Parisian region.

‍

‍
Les Huilettes is committed to protecting our planet by creating skincare products that respect your skin and the world around us. The brand is set on finding a sustainable way of encouraging more reasoned consumption of beauty product, by getting ahead of the curve and designing their products to limit their ecological impact. Les Huilettes believes that together, we can form the good habits that can save our planet.

‍
The brand focuses on the ‘3R’ pillars behind its philosophy – Reduce, Reuse, Recycle – for responsible consumption. Les Huilettes sets out to educate its community on the good habits that can have a major impact.

‍

‍
Les Huilettes uses eco-friendly, recyclable, and reusable packaging- including glass bottles and recycled plastic for their products. Their aim to reduce over-packaging is realised by removing cardboard boxes and not including instructions with their packaging. The brand’s packaging also includes lean printing, meaning that no lamination or microplastics are used by the company.

‍
One of the initiatives that Les Huilettes is promoting is the idea of a circular economy using the 3Rs as its base. As part of this initiative, the brand encourages its customers to sort out its recycling better by separating different elements. They also encourage you to give your bottles a second life. Once you’ve finished your product, you can ask for a return postage slip to return your bottle free of charge to Les Huilettes. Once your bottle is cleaned and reused, you’ll receive a 10% discount off your next order.

‍

‍

Reforestation and Les Huilettes

‍
Another form of action that Les Huilettes is taking is against reforestation. The brand has chosen to sponsor two reforestation projects as part of its environmental initial. In Tarn, they’re supporting the Envol Vert that is developing a conservation project that is restoring old fruit trees and ponds in order to enhance old and local biodiversity.

‍
In India, they’re supporting the Up2green Reforestation program. They’ve chosen to focus their efforts in Tapi in the Gujarat region of India. Les Huilettes’ partnership with Up2green has led to:

‍
- 500 fruit trees (including pomegranate, which is used in their products) being planted.

‍
- A dozen families are the direct beneficiaries and will be able to consume or sell the fruit produced.

‍
- These trees will store around 75 tonnes of CO2 (over 10 years).

‍
Les Huilettes is one of the skincare brands at the heart of the green beauty movement. It’s one of the brands that we’re most excited to see grow in the coming months and years as the vegan and natural beauty movement continues to develop and grow in popularity. With its clever marketing and vegan-friendly formulas, Les Huilettes is one brand that you want to have on your radar.

‍
What do you think of Les Huilettes? Are you fan of green beauty brands? Do you look for brands that use natural ingredients? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
brand-summary: Meet the French clean beauty brand that everyone is talking about - and we mean everyone. Les Huilettes has been featured everywhere from Elle to Vogue and Grazia, amongst other publications. It focuses on feel-good beauty that is kind to your skin and the world around us, putting authenticity, integrity and sensorially at the heart of the brand. This beauty promotes the idea of green and natural beauty, with 100% organic and vegan formulas. These formulas are made using the purest essential oils and virgin vegetable oils that are handpicked for their efficiency and sensorially.

body:
Kure Bazaar is a French nail polish brand that uses natural formulas, founded in 2012 by the fashion model Kartika. Like most natural beauty brands, the inspiration for Kure Bazaar came from Kartika’s real-world experience. The nail polishes in this collection are eco-friendly and composed of 85% natural ingredients, free of harmful substances that are found in most nail products. It offers every colour that under the sun, with a fast-drying formula that has a long-lasting hold and intense colour.

‍

‍

It’s clear that Kure Bazaar is a next-generation nail varnish brand, blending the ethics of eco-friendly formulas with the vibrant colours inspired by the fashion industry. The brand is backed up by years of research into technologically innovative formulas that are free of chemical substances, without compromising on the quality of the varnish. Even with a natural formula, the durability, shine, and gloss of these nail varnishes are top tier.

The Kure Bazaar nail varnish formula is made with up to 90% natural ingredients, including woof pulp, cotton, and wheat to help maintain the health or your nails and their natural regeneration cycle.

‍

‍
What we love about Kure Bazaar is that it was the first brand to combine the ethics of environmentally-friendly formulas with vibrant shades. These nail polishes have ultimate resilience and provide ultra-shine and a quick-dry result. If you want to give your nails a detox while enjoying the chance to experiment with on-trend colours.

‍
If you’ve landed on this article, the chances are that you’re considering purchasing a nail polish from Kure Bazaar or you want to find out more about this clean beauty brand. We’re taking a deep dive into the world of Kure Bazaar, looking at the philosophy of the brand and its natural nail products. Read on to find out everything you need to know about this innovative beauty brand that is changing the nail industry.

‍

About Kure Bazaar

‍
The brand has an exclusive 10-free formula that is up to 90% natural with over 70 exceptional vibrant shades that take their inspiration from the fashion industry. Kure Bazaar is responsible for creating some of the most stylish nail looks that have appeared everywhere from fashion shows to red carpet events. This inventive formula helps to detoxify your nails, while respecting your nail’s natural renewal cycle.

‍
The ‘good nail’ philosophy is about healthier nails in colour, day after day – taking inspiration from the seasons and fashion. The three pillars of this brand focus on detox, colour, and fashion. It falls perfectly into the eco-friendly trend and is cruelty-free.

‍

‍
Kartika, retired professional model, was inspired to start the nail varnish brand after the birth of her son changed her outlook on life, including her diet and cosmetics. Concerned about her children’s health, Kartika changed to focus on natural products that were safe for her, her children, and the environment.

‍
While changing over to more eco-friendly and green beauty brands, Kartika discovered that there was no eco-friendly alternative to the traditional chemical and toxic-infused nail polishes. Her idea for the Kure Bazaar brand came to life, with a goal of creating an ecological nail polish that protects your nail and your overall health.

‍
When it came to creating her brand, Kartika knew that she wanted a formula that was fast-trying, long-lasting, with true colours and an intense shine. She was disappointed after trying a few natural nail polishes, both water-based and non-water based that she could find in organic beauty stores. Kartika’s goal was to create a luxury nail polish brand that could rival the standard of those offered by professional ‘Nail Bar’ brands in the United States.

‍
After several years of research and collaborating with some of the world’s best laboratories and nail polish manufacturers, Kure Bazaar was launched with one of the “cleanest” formulas on the market. The formula by Kure Bazaar shows that natural ingredients can be just as durable and resilient as their toxic and chemical-formed counterparts.

‍

Meet Kartika

‍
As the brands behind the brand, it’s only right that we shine a light on Kartika. She speaks about having an ‘awakening’ while pregnant with her son, quickly switching to eating organic food and changing her cosmetic products. She stopped wearing nail polish for the first few months after giving birth. When it came to launching her nail brand – after discovering there was no ‘green’ formulas on the market – she collaborated with one of her closest friends, who had been in the cosmetic industry for over 20 years.

‍
Her mission is to give women the option of beautiful and vibrant nail colours that are not toxic, with her Jeans collection being amongst one of the most popular releases for the brand. It’s the first collection that earned the brand a profile. The early Kure Bazaar colours focused on fashion-forward and flashy shades, such as classic reds and subtle nude hues. Like any nail varnish brand, Kure Bazaar’s product range also includes a topcoat and base to ensure you can have a fully natural nailcare routine from start to finish.

‍
With the impressive range of shades, you’re guaranteed to find a Kure Bazaar nail varnish that works for you and your complexion.

‍

The ecological commitment of Kure Bazaar Nail Polishes

‍
As an innovative beauty brand, Kure Bazaar has two-fold ecological commitments that form the foundation of its philosophy. As part of our deep-dive into the brand, we’re looking at this commitment and what it means practically for the type of product that you’ll receive from Kure Bazaar.

‍
• The brand has permanent banned four of the most harmful ingredients from its formulas. These include formaldehyde, toluene, phthalates and synthetic camphor.

‍
• They substitute a maximum of synthetic chemistry ingredients with natural-based ingredients.

‍
What this ecological commitment leads to is a ‘high tech’ nail polish with an 85% natural formula with a ‘4 free’ guarantee that certifies the absence of the four previously mentioned toxic ingredients.

‍
Wood pulp, cotton, corn, potato and wheat are all part of the signature Kure Bazaar nail polish formula as they respect and protect your nail’s fragility. This reduced-chemical formula works with the nails’ natural renewal cycle in order to preserve their health and appearance, giving you a natural shine and gloss. With this formula, your nails appear more resistant and detoxified.

It’s worth noting that Kure Bazaar nail polishes are not odor-free. Only water-based nail lacquers are fragrance free, but they have a shorter staying power. Despite not being certified organic, Kure Bazaar products guarantee a more natural, less toxic manicure.

‍
We often talk about green beauty and ‘clean’ beauty revolution. We think of skincare and makeup products, but often overlook that some of the most toxic products are the ones that we put on our nails. If you’re trying to convert to a clean beauty makeup routine, you need to switch out your nail varnish to a non-toxic and natural formula. Kure Bazaar has shown that a natural formula doesn’t mean that you have to compromise on durability or longevity. It’s one of the most exciting nail varnish brands and we can’t wait to see where it goes next.

‍
You can find out more about Kure Bazaar by exploring the brand’s official website here.

‍
What do you think of green beauty brands like Kure Bazaar? Do you look for formulas that are toxin-free? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
brand-summary: Kure Bazaar is a French nail polish brand that uses natural formulas, founded in 2012 by the fashion model Kartika. Like most natural beauty brands, the inspiration for Kure Bazaar came from Kartika’s real-world experience. The nail polishes in this collection are eco-friendly and composed of 85% natural ingredients, free of harmful substances that are found in most nail products. It offers every colour that under the sun, with a fast-drying formula that has a long-lasting hold and intense colour.
meta-description: We’re taking a deep dive into the world of Kure Bazaar, looking at the philosophy of the brand and its natural nail products.
meta-title: Everything You Need to Know About Kure Bazaar
