body:
When it comes to luxury beauty brands, Chantecaille is in a league of its own. It’s made a name for itself as the home of modern botanical skincare and cosmetics. The brand is synonymous with its use of flowers, promoting their natural ability to heal and work in harmony with your body to produce effective results. Chantecaille is known for its ground-breaking scientific research, science-backed formulations, and commitment to using beauty as a tool to change the world. Their products are formulated using the purest ingredients, changing the beauty industry from within.

Chantecaille is more than just a beauty brand, it’s also a philanthropic platform that works to shine a spotlight on global environmental issues and to support conservation efforts around the global. At the heart of Chantecaille is the idea of beauty that gives back.

‍
If you’ve landed on this article, the chances are that you’re considering purchasing something from Chantecaille or you want to find out more about the brand. We’re taking a deep dive into the world of Chantecaille, looking at the philosophy of the brand and its philosophic efforts. Read on to find out everything you need to know about this innovative luxury beauty brand.

The Chantecaille Family

‍
Chantecaille was built through the collaboration of a whole family. Sylvie is the creator of Chantecaille and has more than 30 years of experience, making her one of the industry’s foremost innovators. Her daughter Olivia is the Creative Director and develops the brand’s unique and modern products, while also driving the brand’s vision from a marketing perspective. Alex, another daughter, is the Vice President of Sales and Promotions, travelling around the world to promote the brand. Sylvie’s son, Philippe is the Director of Media Productions and brings his love of art and photography to create the brand’s imagery. Sylvie’s husband, Olivier Chantecaille, is the company’s Chief Financial Officer and combines his business success with a passion for protecting the environment.

The innovation behind Chantecaille

‍
The brand turns to everything from superpowered botanicals to plant stem cells to provide the sustainable ingredients that produce their scientifically backed results. Innovative powers everything that Chantecaille does. Chantecaille works with laboratories around the globe to use cutting edge technology and high-quality ingredients to create revolutionary formulas that have gained the brand an international reputation.

Beauty with results

‍
At the heart of Chantecaille is the idea of ‘beauty with results’, recognising the potential of botanical ingredients to revolutionise skincare. After discovering a field of Rose de Mai in Grasse, Sylvie discovered the potential of rosewater as an anti-aging ingredient. Rosewater has become a key ingredient for the brand as a natural protective ingredient that gives impactful, beautiful, and visible results.

Chantecaille’s philanthropy

‍
Philanthropy is at the heart of everything that Chantecaille does. The brand believe that it’s not enough to just create the perfect formulations. It strives to connect, educate, and provide support for conservation efforts around the global. Every season the brand aligns their products with a cause that needs a vocal platform. Chantecaille has partnered with causes that protect everything from our oceans to our forests, lions, and gorillas.

Chantecaille’s commitments

‍
Environmental philanthropy began as a passion for Sylvie Chantecaille before becoming a 20-year-long commitment that is now at the heart of the brand. It started after her love for gardening led her to discover the crisis of the disappearing Monarch butterflies, which led to the brand’s first philanthropy partnership.

‍
Here is a round up of some of the causes that are at the heart of the brand’s environmental philanthropy.

‍
• Coral Reefs

‍
Among the most diverse ecosystems on earth, and a key indicator of ocean health. Our coral reefs are extremely fragile and in danger due to climate change, industrial fishing and pollution, including from beauty products like chemical sunscreen. Chantecaille’s reef-safe SeaScreen 30 supports WildAid Marine’s work to strengthen the protection of Tanzania’s Pemba Channel.

‍
• Butterflies & Other Pollinators

‍
Butterflies, bees, and other pollinators help ecosystems thrive—but are declining at an alarming rate. Chantecaille is supporting the Xerces Society, which works to conserve invertebrates and their habitats by regenerating native landscapes, in turn promoting a vibrant food system.

‍
• Orphaned Elephants

‍
Chantecaille’s Future Skin Cushion Foundation supports their longtime conservation partners Sheldrick Wildlife Trust in orphaned elephant rehabilitation program and work safeguarding natural habitats for all species across Kenya. Every cushion foundation helps feed an orphan baby elephant rescued by the Sheldrick Wildlife Trust. 1 cushion foundation = 1 bottle of milk.

‍
• Africa's Vanishing Species

‍
The brand’s Luminescent Eye Shades were created to support six of Africa’s most endangered species: the rhinoceros, cheetah, giraffe, elephant, lion and pangolin. All of these wild animals face the threat of disappearing habitats, conflict with humans, including illegal poaching.

‍
• African Elephants

‍
Chantecaille created their Lip Veil in support of their longtime partner Space for Giants. It supports their vital work protecting African elephants, the landscapes they depend on, and the community near them. These wild species and spaces face unprecedented threats from the global pandemic and economic crisis.

‍
• Vibrant Oceans

‍
In July 2019, WildAid invited Chantecaille to Isla Mujeres, an island in Mexico where whale sharks in summer. This unique trip gathered conservation activists to experience their magnificent beauty up close, and to bring attention to the growing crisis of the illegal wildlife trade.

‍
• Amazon Hummingbirds

‍
Hummingbirds are a symbol of a healthy Amazon and biodiversity. Protecting the hummingbird is vital for the health of the planet and all of us who live on it. With the brand’s limited-edition Lip Chic, they’re raising $75,000 to help the ASOMI indigenous women’s association buy back 75 acres of their Amazon home.

‍
• One Lipstick, One Tree

‍
The Holiday Lip Chics by Chantecaille support the work of fighting climate change. For each lipstick sold, Chantecaille will plant a tree in Kenya with Sheldrick Wildlife Trust. Their partners have been planting saplings around national parks and forests that they manage in Kenya to protect habitat and support local communities. Together with SWT, Chantecaille planted 60,000 trees in 2019.

‍
• Asian Elephants

‍
Asian elephants face similar threats from shrinking wilderness and runaway human population growth as their African cousin. Chantecaille partnered with Elephant Family on a limited-edition Lip Veil to help protect the Asian elephant from extinction in the wild.

‍
• Philanthropy Cheek Shades Collection

‍
This collection of cheek shades features six embossed compacts that benefit the conservation efforts for Monarch butterflies, which kick-started the brand’s passion for philanthropy and protecting endangered species. It also includes supporting other environmental causes, like protecting the coral reef.

About the founder of Chantecaille

‍
Now that you’ve had an insight into Chantecaille and its philanthropic efforts, it’s only right that we turn the attention on the woman behind the brand – Sylvie Chantecaille. She began by studying history of art and theatre in Paris before moving to New York, where she created her first cosmetic company in partnership with her friend, Diane von Furstenberg. The cult-favourite perfume, Tatiana, was part of the cosmetic range.
In the late 1970s, the Lauder family came to Sylvie and asked her to launch a new beauty brand – Prescriptives – which took a new approach to cosmetics. She led some of the most exciting innovative developments at the brand, including launching the best-selling fragrance, Calyx.
Sylvie describes how she fell into the beauty industry by accident. It was the success of her fragrance with DVF that led her to further explore the potential within the industry.

‍
The concept for Chantecaille was to create a niche French fragrance house that offered four original scents, each based on natural essential oils. Within 18 months, Sylvie realised that her passion was in aromatherapy, high-quality skincare, and natural products. Her goal was to make products that made women feel beautiful, while also being healthy for their skin.

What makes Chantecaille unique and different

‍
What makes Chantecaille stand out from the ground is its commitment to high-quality ingredients and pure formulas. The brand is committed to sourcing the most effective botanical ingredients and working with experts to create tailored products. Chantecaille is a truly international brand – they develop their foundations in Japan, skincare in Switzerland, and produce their fragrance in France. When Chantecaille started, no one was working on products that were both backed by science and powered by botanical ingredients at the same time.

‍
Philanthropy and conservation is at the forefront of everything that the company does. Since 2006, the brand has launched 29 different limited edition Philanthropy Collections with the aim of benefiting specific conservation efforts. Every season, the brand donates a percentage of proceeds form the sales of these products directly to the charitable organisations.

‍
Chantecaille is a luxury beauty brand that is changing the industry from within. More of us than ever are choosing to prioritise sustainability and environmental issues when choosing which brands to support. When you buy a Chantecaille item, you know that your product is fuelled with natural and sustainable ingredients, while often directly helping important conservation work that can make a major difference for the world around.

‍
What do you think of Chantecaille? Have you ever shopped from the brand before? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
brand-summary: When it comes to luxury beauty brands, Chantecaille is in a league of its own. It’s made a name for itself as the home of modern botanical skincare and cosmetics. The brand is synonymous with its use of flowers, promoting their natural ability to heal and work in harmony with your body to produce effective results. Chantecaille is known for its ground-breaking scientific research, science-backed formulations, and commitment to using beauty as a tool to change the world. Their products are formulated using the purest ingredients, changing the beauty industry from within.
meta-description: Chantecaille is more than just a beauty brand, it’s also a philanthropic platform that works to shine a spotlight on global environmental issues.

body:
Do you own a hair salon or are you in search of premium haircare products that are a gamechanger? Meet O’Barber Shop. This passionate team sets off to unearth and test the latest treatments on the market that are being used by the world’s most famous and renowned barber. If there’s a product about to gain cult-following status, the O’Barber Shop will know about it. The company specialises in supplying beard, moustache, and haircare products to barbers and beardsmen.

‍
They pride themselves on selecting the best products to help you maintain and look after your beard. It serves as a one-stop shop for all your beard and moustache needs. You can enjoy salon quality products in the comfort of your own home, whether it’s beard oils or precious shaving gel, along with detangling brushes and beard balm. These products form the foundation of your everyday beard-care routine.

O’Barber Shop

‍
The purpose of O’Barber Shop is to provide men with salon-quality products that allow them to take care of their bodies from head to toe. Every product is thoroughly tested by the O’Barber Shop team and comes with their seal of approval. Their product range is carefully chosen to offer something for every beard and hair type, so that you’re guaranteed to find the right products for you.

‍
Along with selling directly to customers, O’Barber Shop is a leading supplier of products to barbers and salons. They consider themselves to be at the heart of the so-called ‘barbershop eco-system’. Part of their goal is to predict trends and foresee the needs of barbershops and customers with innovative products and accessories that every bearded man needs.

‍
O’Barber Shop works with some of the most popular barbershops across Europe, who exclusively source their products from the brand. Along with beard and moustache products, O’Barber Shop also offers face and body products to fit every man’s needs.

‍
The vision of O’Barber Shop is to allow men to take control of their lives and achieve a sense of fulfilment by adopting a new lifestyle that puts their image front and centre. Part of their goal is to offer the latest cutting-edge products to both consumers and barbershops, selecting only the ‘cream of the crop’ to help you look after your hair and skin.

O’Barber Shop’s Beard and Moustache Products

‍
The brand prides itself on offering every product that you need, regardless of your beard-care concerns. For those with dry beards, the team has uncovered the most nourishing oils that offer intense hydration, tackle dandruff, and leave your beard soft to the touch.

‍
If you have a short beard, O’Barber Shop offer a curated collection of beard oils and balms that are specially formulated to care for shorter beards. These lightweight oils are designed to hydrate your beard, leaving it silky smooth.

‍
The product range also extends to helping those who want to have the shortest beard possible that is trimmed to the contours. These products help you achieve a precise shave that allows you to outline the contours of your beard. You get a perfect glide with added skin protection to prevent tightness and irritation with tested products that are approved by the O’Barber Shop team.

‍
Whatever your beard concerns are, the O’Barber Shop team have gone out of their way to curate a collection of products that work for everyone. Their product range also extends to styling products that help you maintain the shape and look of your beard or moustache.

Shaving Products

‍
Part of the O’Barber Shop product range is shaving products that allow you to achieve a precise shave. They offer everything you need for a salon-quality shave, from soaps to gels and shaving cream, along with aftershave cream and balms.

‍
Their e-commerce shop is packed full of salon-quality products like safety razors and shaving brushes so that you can always stay on top of your haircare routine. O’Barber Shop is on a mission to help you achieve a clean shave without compromising on quality or comfort.

Brands Offered by O’Barber Shop

‍
Part of O’Barber Shop’s mission is to provide the most innovative products directly to consumers and barber shops across Europe. We’re taking an overview of just a few of the brands that they stock, to give you a taste of what to expect from the company.

‍
Big Red

‍
Big Red is an innovative company that makes the world’s best wooden beard comb. They’re made by hand in the Colombia forest in Canada, alongside beard oils and balms. Big Red is a brand synonymous with craftsmanship and high-quality products.

‍

‍
 Can You Handlebar

‍
Can You Handlebar is a USA based company that takes the spirit of the ‘Old School Barbershops’ and brings them into the modern era with products that allow men to unlock their inner masculinity. This brand is a favourite amongst bikers and those with very long beards!

‍
The Birth of Coucot

‍
The Birth of Coucot was established by Julie Lambert-Coucot in 2013 from her workshop in Croix. Her hair accessories is made using the highest quality materials, with beard and moustache combs that allow you to make a statement wherever you go.

‍

‍
Daimon Barber

‍
If you’re a fan of refinement and the charm of the classic English gentleman, look no further than Daimon Barber. The brand was launched in London in 2013 by Leo and Daimon, two brothers on a mission to create the next generation of beard, hair, and shaving products. The brand is still relatively unknown in France, making O’Barber Shop one of the few places to find their products.

‍
Dapper Dan

‍
Established in Sheffield in 2011, Dapper Dan seeks to fill the gap in the styling product niche for the modern gentleman. Their products are fuelled by over ten years of experience within the industry, with a drive and ambition to create one of the most diverse and unique product ranges for men. Dapper Dan has gone through the O’Barber Shop testing with flying colours.

‍

‍
F*cking Barber

‍
Meet the mysterious F*cking Barber brand that acts as an experimental laboratory, bringing together the latest in hair and beard innovation to get capsule collections that are used by the most famous barbers around the world.

‍

‍
Noberu

‍
Noberu is one of the largest product ranges offered by O’Barber Shop and is the brainchild of two Swedes, Johan and Iman. Their goal was to create products that allowed men to embrace an elegant persona with efficient products that got the job done.

‍
The brand has quickly started to appear in barbershops across the world, including their special dry beard oil and dedicated product range for shorter beards.

‍

‍
Reuzel

‍
Reuzel is another extensive product range offered by O’Barber Shop and is one brand that everyone is talking about in the barbershop world. These products are made by Schoerm Barbier, one of the most famous barbershops in the world that is based in Rotterdam. O’Barber Shop is the official distributor of Reuzel products in France.

‍

‍
Rich by Rick Ross

‍
For luxury grooming products, look no further than Rich by Rick Ross. O’Barber Shop caters to costumers and barbershops across the spectrum, including those looking for aluxury experience. The brand offers everything from shampoo to shaving cream and after shave.
What makes this brand so unique is its ingredient extracts, including caviar, champagne, and hemp. This cruelty-free grooming brand offers the ultimate ‘Boss’ experience for every man who wants a luxury experience at an attainable price point.

‍

‍
The Bearded Chap

‍
Established in 1986, Bearded Chap is an Australian brand and one of the oldest stocked by O’Barber Shop. Their products offer a mix of formulas that work for everyone from the modern businessman to the wild spirited surfer.

‍

‍
Uppercut

‍
One brand you don’t want to be sleeping on within the O’Barber Shop product range is Uppercut. This Australian brand is the work of Luke Newman and Steve Purcell, two childhood friends who took their love of hairdressing and skateboarding to the next level.

‍
Their goal was to create high-quality men’s skincare products with the best ingredients, while bringing back the barbershop spirit that is synonymous with the 1950s. The brand’s first product was their now-infamous ‘Pomade deluxe’ wax. Today, their product range includes everything you could need for your haircare routine.

‍
The brand’s DNA is influenced by Luke Newman’s grandfather, Willy Uppercut O’Shea, a former boxer who lived by the moto of ‘a tough start makes a good start’, which became the philosophy of Uppercut itself.

‍
It’s considered one of the best grooming brands in the world and counts the skater Eric Dressen, surfer Matt Chojnacki, and the California Cycle Zombies bikers amongst their ambassadors.

‍
What attracted us to O’Barber Shop was their commitment to delivering the highest-quality and most exciting products for their consumers and barbershop partners. The team thoroughly test every product to make sure it meets their standards. If you’re entering the world of beard-care for the first time – of if you’re an expert yourself – you’ll feel right at home with O’Barber Shop.

‍
Don’t forget to check out O’Barber Shop on Instagram to stay up to date with their latest products and how-to videos.

‍
Have you heard of O’Barber Shop? Which of their brands are you most excited to try? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
brand-summary: Do you own a hair salon or are you in search of premium haircare products that are a gamechanger? Meet O’Barber Shop. This passionate team sets off to unearth and test the latest treatments on the market that are being used by the world’s most famous and renowned barber. If there’s a product about to gain cult-following status, the O’Barber Shop will know about it. The company specialises in supplying beard, moustache, and haircare products to barbers and beardsmen.

body:
Is there anything more magical than finding the perfect lipstick shade? Well, you’re in the right place! We’re introducing you to La Bouche Rouge, one of our favourite Parisian makeup brands that has already developed a cult-following amongst influencers and celebrities. If you’re a makeup mogul or like to be ahead of the trends, then La Bouche Rouge is one brand that you need to have on your radar.
We’re taking a deep dive into the brand, telling you their origin story, what makes them unique, and why you need to add a La Bouche Rouge lipstick to your makeup bag. Warning: these items are all an instant  ‘add to cart’ purchase. Go on – treat yourself!

About La Bouche Rouge

‍
La Bouche Rouge stands for ‘red lips’ in French, but it’s also about using your voice and delivering a striking message. The goal of the brand is to reinvent beauty standards and give people the opportunity to reinterpret trends as they see it. Lipstick is your playground and an opportunity to express your personality – whether your signature shade is crimson red or baby pink.

‍
La Bouche Rouge describes itself not in paragraphs of text, but in it’s own take on a definition. La Bouche Rouge stands for aesthetic practicality, the makeup that you can reply on to take you seamlessly from day to night. Their goal is to affirm and aspire their audience to embrace their natural beauty. The brand’s refillable design makes this an environmentally friendly beauty brand that we’re all ready to jump on board with.

‍
Part of the La Bouche Rouge mission is to get you to embrace the classic Parisian chic and elegance, while discarding the excessive promises that the industry has made you. Their makeup is all about celebrating French craftsmanship with the opportunity to experience modern luxury through sustainability, while engaging in a socially responsible act.

‍
Who knew beauty could be so deep? La Bouche Rouge offers beauty products that are kind to you and the planet, with a refillable and responsible design. The brand even has its own hashtag to support its sustainability mission – #kissfortheearth.

What Makes La Bouche Rouge Different

‍
With thousands of beauty brands to choose from, you want to know what makes this one different. The mission of La Bouche Rouge is clean beauty that is better for you and better for the planet. The brand is committed to creating a kinder world in which we celebrate the beauty of nature and restore the practice of embracing conscious acts.

‍
Choosing to have their own independent laboratory was a big step and ambitious investment for any beauty brand, but it shows how dedicated the team were to create an unforgettable beauty range. Every formula created in the laboratory must stick by the red list and surpass every test it is put through.
At La Bouche Rouge, they’ve said au revoir to plastic forever. Not even recycled plastic makes an appearance in their packaging. What we love about La Bouche Rouge is its French craftsmanship. The brand is on a mission to reintroduce the artesian transition to the beauty industry. Who wants plastic packaging when you can have the beauty of an artisan piece?

‍
One of our favourite things about La Bouche Rouge is their refillable packaging. Their plastic-free cases are 100% recyclable and refillable. Once you’ve finished your lipstick, you can refill your personalised case with just one click.

‍
The beauty industry is the third most polluting industry after automotive and the fashion industry. La Bouche Rogue has firmly passed on everything plastic and chosen to create plastic-free packaging. The brand’s pure formulas are free of PMMA and microplastics – because you shouldn’t be wearing those ingredients on your lips in the first place.

‍
La Bouche Rouge’s plastic-free packaging uses stainless steel and leather from the Tanneries du Puy. We love the fact that the brand is using French craftsmanship as a way to fight against plastic and promote environmental sustainability.

‍
It’s not just the lipstick packaging that is sustainable. The glass bottle of the Le Serum Noir and Eyebrow serum is an innovative milestone as every piece is designed to be both durable and recyclable. The glass is produced in France using traditional glassmaking techniques and features a 100% recyclable metal cap.
The brushes and wiping ring on these products are amongst the first in the world to be made without microplastics. The brushes use castor plant fiber as a more sustainable alternative, offering you the flexibility to lengthen and thicken your lashes to add extra volume and definition to your look.
The Universal Powder comes with a plastic-free, infinitely refillable packaging. Sustainable practices appear throughout the brand’s production line, including by skipping on classic silicone molds that most beauty brands use.

‍
La Bouche Rouge’s commitment to avoid plastic is also visible in their store, where they have a zero plastic policy. Their stores use reusable materials and bio-based and compostable poly-bags.

La Bouche Rouge’s Clean Serum Formulas

‍
Their ‘clean serum formula’ is created and developed in the brand’s own laboratory in France. La Bouche Rouge produces their products without petrochemical derivates and with respect for the planet and its people.

‍
The La Bouche Rouge makeup is vegan friendly, made without beeswax, animal fat or microplastic and is not tested on animals. Every ingredient is tested and chosen based on its origin, quality, and efficacy.
The formula of the La Serum Rogue lipstick is up to 99% natural with organic ingredients and made without petroleum derivates or silicone. This product is a lip treatment that takes its inspiration from the brown algae from Saint Suliac. The formula is enhanced with hyaluronic acid and a trio of ultra-concentrated natural active ingredients to make this lipstick glide on like a dream.

‍
It’s not just lipsticks that La Bouche Rouge offers. It’s worth spotlighting their lip liner pencils, which are made using cedar rood and an infinitely recyclable metal cap. These liners have 88% to 99% natural origin ingredients in their formulas, including word ingredients like castor oil, biasbolol, vitamin E, and squalene. These ingredients help you achieve a sharp line with a precise application process.

‍
The Lip Care Routine offers up to 99% natural origin ingredients, with both hyaluronic acid and brown algae extracts from Saint Suliac. This lip scrub is made using vegetable oils and cranberry grains. You can use the night serum as a lip mask as it contains a high concentration of vitamin E, which will lock-in your lips’ moisture.

‍
La Serum Noir has a 99% natural origin ingredient formula, as well as including carnauba wax, which coats your lashes while helping them maintain their strength and volume. With its castor fibers and jojoba oil, the La Serum Noir gives you definition and volume to your lashes. It’s an all-in-one treatment that is easy to remove and beginner friendly.

‍
La Bouche Rogue’s Le Khol Noir is a black eyeliner made with cedar wood and features an infinitely recyclable metal cap. This product has a 98% natural ingredient formula, including castor oil, squalene, and vitamin E. You’ll be able to master the art of the winged eyeliner with this pencil that glides onto your eyelids with ease for an elegant look and powdered effect.

‍
The brand’s Natural Powders contain up to 95% natural origin ingredients and are made without talc. The formula is infused with hyaluronic acid to give your skin long-term hydration, with rice powder taking the place of commonly used silicones, along with mica that has been sourced by the Responsible Mica Initiative.

‍
La Bouche Rogue’s The Eyebrow Serum puts you in control of your brows, letting you naturally set and tame their shape. Its 93% natural origin ingredient formula features pistachio oil that helps boost your brow hair growth, along with green caviar extract, a microalgae that has protective and anti-ageing properties.

The Blacklist of Ingredients

‍
La Bouche Rouge isn’t afraid to make a statement – and then some. The brand has an extensive list of ingredients that they do not use in their products, in fact, they call these ingredients the ‘true enemies’ and have them on a dedicated blacklist on their website. La Bouche Rogue chooses every ingredient based on its origin, efficacy, and quality before adding them to their skincare-infused makeup formulas.

‍
The extensive blacklist includes everything from microplastics that harm our lips and damage to the oceans to parabens and silicones. Importantly, the black list also features two ingredients in a dedicated ‘our false enemies’ section. Titanium dioxide and aluminium oxide are two ingredients that are often rumoured to be harmful but that La Bouche Rouge does not consider harmful for humans or the planet.
Titanium dioxide is a natural pigment that can be used in organic beauty products and poses no health concerns. Aluminium oxide is a functional ingredient and differs from elemental aluminium, which does not absorb easily into the skin.

‍
If you’ve been searching for the next-generation beauty brand that everyone will be talking about – you’ve found it! La Bouche Rouge is amongst our greatest beauty secrets.

‍
What do you think of La Bouche Rogue? Will you be buying one of their products? Let us know in the comments below!

‍

‍
brand-summary: Is there anything more magical than finding the perfect lipstick shade? Well, you’re in the right place! We’re introducing you to La Bouche Rouge, one of our favourite Parisian makeup brands that has already developed a cult-following amongst influencers and celebrities. If you’re a makeup mogul or like to be ahead of the trends, then La Bouche Rouge is one brand that you need to have on your radar.

body:
The story of Garancia Beauty is a humble one is that has made us fall in love with this brand. In 1908, Pierre Girault, the great-grandfather of Saveria Coste opened his pharmacy in Marseille. He specialised in botany, cosmetic preparations with plants. His son, Fernand Stanislas Girault and his wife followed suit as pharmacists, along with their son and his wife. Each generation would take over the pharmacy and create a self-service space that was dedicated to the idea of ‘holistic beauty’.
The Girault pharmacy was different than anything else on the market, packed-full of innovative products, with a focus on dermo-cosmetics, wellness products, and herbal tea. When Saveria Girault was born, she already had a love and passion for cosmetic preparation and plants. Saveria is a fourth-generation pharmacist and the CEO of Garnacia.

We’re taking a deep-dive into this brand to see what makes it tick, why it’s such a popular pharmacy brand, and how it is one of France’s best-kept beauty secrets.
Labratoire Garancia continues to innovate and offer the best of their products for you to choose from. They strive to offer the latest in health care and ethical products that offer both health and efficiency; two founding principles of Granacia’s development as a brand.

Garancia Beauty’s Approach to Products

‍
Saveria Coste, the brand’s CEO, has said that she is committed to creating ‘healthy and effective cosmetics that are respectful to our skin and therefore for our health’. She describes the processes of creating products as involving the ‘universe of magic…with a touch of witchcraft’. Coste’s childhood imagination plays a key part in creating these innovative products that service to create a sensory experience, along with a skincare one.

‍
You can personify the idea of Garancia beauty from the simple philosophy within the brand – beauty is inseparable from pleasure.

‍
Coste choose natural ingredients if they are healthy and passes her two test. The ingredients have to be visibly effective, delivering fast and scientifically proven results. Every product is respectful of our skin, therefore being considerate of overall skin health.

‍
Garancia does not believe that using a synthetic active ingredient means that you have a questionable formula on your hands – rather the opposite. Some of the most effective and healthy molecules in the industry right now are peptides. It’s the same way the brand is not in favourite of the term ‘organic’. Just because of a product is ‘organic’ doesn’t meant that it is not without risk to your health or as effective as non-natural ingredients.

‍
What Granacia does is blend natural and synthetic active ingredients to create impactful formulas that are efficient and as natural as possible, while still being healthy for our skin.

‍
Saveria has said that she wants her formulas to ”be healthy but also sensory, evocative of dreams and emotions” because beauty and pleasure go hand in hand. Scent in essential in every product. Certain scents stimulate different areas of the brain and can also be beneficial for your skin.

‍
Recent research has shown that there are olfactory receptors within the epidermis of your skin, showing the power that scent has to transform your appearance. Every Garancia cream is lightweight and incorporates a captivating scent that is made using an allergen-free fragrance in a small dose.
Old rose and orange blossom fragrances are amongst the most popular for Garancia products as they remind Saveria of her childhood and act as a time machine to transport you anywhere in the world. It’s worth noting that Garanacia products do have fragrance in them, which can cause natural or synthetic allergens. Only between 2-3% of the population will show signs of fragrance sensitivity, which doesn’t rule out fragrance as a helpful ingredient.

Garancia Ingredients

‍
Speaking of ingredients, lets take a deep dive into the different ingredient that Garancia uses. As the brand is remarkably open about their product development. Like any plant-based skincare brand, Garancia is quick to show off her credentials within the industry.

‍
The purpose of Garancia’s ingredients is to create “healthy, sensory formulas that are so effective”. They become like folklore within your office and amongst your friends. Once you start using a Garancia product, you can be sure that your friends and family will need to know who your dermatologist is.
Every Garancia formula contains between 95 and 99% natural ingredients. You can check the exact percentage of each product either online or when you come to see the baby in-store.
What makes Garancia so successful is the brand’s ability to bring together the best of nature with the best of science. They strive to get quick and staple result, including using synthetic active ingredients that don’t cause the infamous questioning ingredient.

‍
You’ll notice that the ingredients list for Garancia products is intentionally short. It’s not the number of products that makes a formula effective, but rather their quality and concentration. To make the formulas as efficient as possible, Garancia uses a high percentage of active ingredients, as they no longer have a small budget for their formulas.

‍
The brand’s CEO, Saveria Coste, has said that she chooses ingredients whose effectiveness has been proven by clinical research and study. Ingredients with speed and efficiency behind them are at the heart of the formulation process and part of Garancia’s DNA.

‍
Saveria describes her formulation process as being led by science, asking herself whether any ingredient could be substituted for a better one. With advances in cosmetologically research ongoing and the industry becoming more innovative every day, Garancia continues to reformulate certain products to incorporate the latest in ingredient research. Their products only use non-nanco titanium dioxide, which does not have any nanoparticles.

‍
Garancia is constantly improving their formulas in order to provide the safest and most effective products for their customer. Natural emulsifiers with an intelligent system appear within several of the products. Along with having the basic purpose of creating an emulsion, these ingredients add extra benefits to the formula, like hydration and skin protection. They allow the active ingredients to penetrate through the surface of the skin and can even been formulated cold to reduce energy use.

What You Won’t Find in Garancia Products

‍
Every Garancia product is GMO free and is made without animal oils or fats. The brand deliberately avoids ‘questionable’ ingredients that have not been thoroughly research. If they have a reason to doubt the health impact of an ingredient, or believe there is a better alternative, the ingredient won’t feature in the product.

‍
Garancia is continuing to develop and evolve their products to keep ahead of the beauty industry and to continue to provide leading products that meet the needs of every consumer. For example, Garancia is working to replace the EDTA – a preservation booster – from three of their products as the ingredient is not particularly biodegradable. Products that have already been reformulated to remove out-dated ingredients include two older products that had had their silicone removed.

‍
The brand’s CEO names additives and preservatives as her “pet peeve”.  During the formulation stage, the brand allows the texture and colour to evolve and change from one to the other. They avoid using additives, chemical filters, or dyes to achieve a particular look once the product is in the container.
While you will find fragrance in most of the Garanacia products, they avoid using essential oils as more people tend to be allergic to them than everyday perfume notes.

‍
Other ingredients that you won’t find in Garancia products include sodium laureth sulfate, lauryl sulfate, and cocamido derivaties as they can contain unwanted impurities. Other ingredients that you won’t find in these products include paraffin oil, which is replaced with vegetable oils instead.

‍
The Garancia formulas can be summed up in two words – health and efficiency. The ethics at the heart of the brand is to choose ingredients that work for your skin and don’t harm our eco-systems or biodiversity. Garanacia has a full list of ingredients that their products are formulated without on their website for you to check out. It’s worth reading if you know there are specific ingredients that irritate your skin or if you want to check-up on the brand’s ‘natural’ credentials.

The Four Fundamental Pillars of Granacia

‍
Like every modern skin care brand, Garancia is driven by a philosophy that is articulated in four fundamental pillars that they follow when designing any new treatment.

‍
1. Clean and responsible
The brand is committed to using healthy and minimal ingredients with concentrated formulas. 100% of their treatments are rated as good by consumers, while the reduction in ingredients make products more environmentally friendly.
100% of the brand’s packaging comes from sustainably managed forests and recycled plastic.

‍
2. Effective
At the heart of Garancia is a mission to create effective skincare products that give you quick but proven results. The brand continues to collaborate with researches around the world using patented innovations and high-tech research.

‍
3. Natural
The secret to the success of Garancia is the fact that its ingredients list comes from the best of what nature has to offer. For every poroduct, you’ll see between 95 and 99% of ingredients are naturally occurring.

‍
4. Sensory
To create a sensory experience, Garanceia focuses on developing astonishing textures and captivating the light to make every woman feel as though the scent of Garancela can take them on an international adventure.

‍
Have you tried any of the Garanceia products? Are you interested in finding out more about the brand? Let us know in the comments below!

‍

His son, Fernand Stanislas Girault and his wife followed suit as pharmacists, along with their son and his wife. Each generation would take over the pharmacy and create a self-service space that was dedicated to the idea of ‘holistic beauty’.

body:
When it comes to innovative skincare brands, we count Dr. Barbara Sturm amongst our favourites. This brand is on a mission to educate a generation of skincare users and offers next-generation products that perform modern miracles with a little help from science. Dr. Barbara Sturm offers everything from supercharged serums to deluxe face creams and intense hydration drops. Their products are famous for their anti-aging (and age-defying!) properties.
Dr. Barbara Sturm specialises in so-called ‘age-defying skin solutions’. The brand’s Dusseldorf clinic is infamous amongst the elite and some of the world’s most recognisable celebrities. Do you remember the famous ‘vampire facial’? Dr. Sturm is who Kim Kardashian West visits to get her treatment.
This innovative product range is packed full of active ingredients, including antioxidants that rejuvenate your skin, strengthen your natural protective barrier, and promote cellular regeneration. You don’t have to fly to Germany to experience the magic of Dr. Barbara Sturm. Thanks to her product range, you can take advantage of these innovative formula and products from the comfort of your home.

Who is Dr. Barbara Strum?

‍
Dr. Barbara Strum is an anti-aging orthopaedic doctor who specialises in combating inflammation. She changed over to aesthetics almost twenty years ago, bringing her inventions and science-backed practices into the industry. It is Dr. Strum’s expertise and medical precision that has developed her anti-inflammatory philosophy that has made her brand what it is today.

‍
Her journey over to skincare was a gradual one, bringing with her everything that she learnt within the sports industry, including repair within osteoarthritis and orthopaedics.
Dr. Strum is considered to be one of the best-kept secrets within the beauty industry and her products stock the shelves of some of Hollywood’s most famous faces. Dr. Barbara Strum first gained the attention of beauty editors and the public in 2002 when her innovative ‘blood plasma facial’ – now known as the vampire facial – entered the market. It was quickly followed by her wonder product, the MC1 cream, which you can only get your hands on by visiting one of her clinics.
If you want to get your hands on this MC1 cream, you’ll have to join growing waitlist. The MC1 cream is a bespoke plasma-based cream that mixes your white blood cells and proteins with the moisturiser to give you naturally glowing skin.

‍
The Dr. Barbara Strum brand hit the shelves of skincare stores in 2014 and are now available in 52 countries, including in spas and boutiques across the world. You can find it in Dusseldorf, New York, and Los Angeles. Dr. Strum is famous for her pop-up spa that is hosted during Paris Fashion Week.
What is unique about Dr. Barbara Strum is that the brand remains independent, while other smaller brands are being bought up by conglomerates. Her ‘healthy scepticism’ of overly marketed terms like ‘clean’ and ‘organic’ has won her the praise of beauty editors across the spectrum.

What makes Dr. Barbara Strum Products Special?

‍
Every Dr. Barbara Strum product is packed full of powerful naturally occurring and advanced science ingredients that are highly effective, non-irritating, non-toxic, and cruelty-free. The aim of these products is for them to be easy to use and incorporate into your skincare routine.

‍
The brand choses not to apply labels like ‘organic’ or ‘natural’ to their products, as they believe these labels don’t have a consistent definition or impact the safety or efficiency of the product. Although Dr. Barbara Strum is an internationally recognised brand, they have chosen not to sell in China in order to maintain their cruelty-free production.
Almost every Dr. Barbara Strum product is made without parabens, with the exception of the Sun Drops SPF 50, which includes a low concentration to maintain its stability. Any fragrance that is incorporated into these products are kept at a level that is proven tolerable for sensitive skin.
While you won’t see the name ‘vegan’ applied to these products, almost all of the formulas are made entirely of vegan ingredients. One ingredient that is not vegan is the cruelty-free beeswax that appears in numerous products.
Although you’ll find other brands using influencers to promote their products, Dr. Barbara Strum still believes that word of mouth is the greatest marketing power. She told Vogue that “if you formulate great products with a clear effect, people will use them religiously and evangelise them too”.
It’s a good thing that the word of mouth behind Dr. Barbara Strum includes the likes of Rosie Huntington-Whiteley, Emily Ratajkowski, Emma Roberts, and Bella Hadid. When Dr. Strum hosted her #SturmMaskathon in May 2020 as a global live fundraiser for WHO and First Responders First, her guest list could rival even the most significant award shows. Everyone from Alessandra Ambrosio to Jason Wu, Maria Sharapavoa and Nicole Scherzinger appeared on screen.

‍
Dr. Barbara Strum’s digital marketing strategy has focused on educating through masterclasses – featuring co-hosts like Rachel Zoe and Matthew Walker – alongside educational and self-care videos on TikTok, Instagram, and YouTube.

‍

Dr. Barbara Sturm offers everything from supercharged serums to deluxe face creams and intense hydration drops. Their products are famous for their anti-aging (and age-defying!) properties.

body:
Talika is a Parisian brand with a unique heritage and history. It’s quickly becoming one of our go-to brands and we consider it to be a hidden secret within the French beauty community. We’re pulling back the curtain and introducing you to the Talika brand and showing you what makes it special. Our guide looks at the history of the brand and the journey that has made Talika the company it is today.
When Tailka was founded in 1948, it was originally an eye care line that offered an innovative balm that helped with lash and brow growth. Now, the brand is virtually unrecognisable from its humble beginnings, although it has made a return to its original packaging for this one product.
This French brand has gone from its humble beginners to gain millions of loyal followers across the world. Talika has been operating in the fashion industry for over 70 years, making it a leading expert in eye care products. The brand launched with a range of supercharged topical formulas that offer innovative solution of your beauty care needs.

The History of Talika

‍
Talika launched its first product, an eye cream, in 1948. Legend has it that Danielle Roches, a young eye specialist, was treating the war-wounded in Paris. She made a special cream using plant extracts to help treat their injuries. Not only did it boost their recovery, but the eye cream also led to growth in the patient’s eyelashes and eyebrows.
Faced with pharmaceutical shortages, Danielle developed and formulated her balm with healing plants to help treat the burns of victims who found their way to the Ophthalmic Department of the Hospitals of Paris. After seeing its potential as an eyebrow and eyelash product, it’s no surprise that Danielle Roches chose to commercialise the product by launching the first skin care product that was marketed exclusively at eyelashes. Her Eyelash Conditioning Cream set the wheels in motion for the future of the Talika brand.
This discovery would lead to the origins of Lipocils, the legendary treatment that stimulates lash growth and the driving force behind the success of Talika products.
Danielle would go on to establish Talika, focused on creating eye care products. While Talika is a pioneering brand within this niche, it is starting to expand its formulas to include face, hands, and body treatments.
Talika has been a pioneering brand since the moment of its inception. Under the leadership of Alexis de Brossess, Talika has made the decision to return to its roots – literally, inf act! The brand has gone back to its original Eyelash Conditioning Cream formula and packaging and modernised it. During this time, inspiration struck and the brand also created the LIPOCILS eyelash stimulator.
Armed with its LIPOCILS eyelash growth product, Talika set out to conquer the Japanese market. Anyone who is familiar with the Korean beauty industry will know that Korean market can make or break the success of just about anything.
The Talika product range is now stocked in over 60 countries and the name I synonymous with eyebrow treatment.

Talika Products

‍
Talika is one brand that has always drawn its inspiration from the world around it. Since 1948, Talika has been taking inspiration from the treasures of the living world to create innovative and imaginative treatments that allow you to regain your natural beauty.
Part of the philosophy behind Talika is that a woman’s beauty doest noct ome from her physiology or dermatology, but from her soul and spirit. This all-embracing approaching is what makes Talika different from traditional cosmetics. Alexis de Brosses points to the ability of Talika to bring together biotechnology, Ayurveda, herbal medicine, and NASA’ latest discoveries, along with industry secrets, as the reason behind its success.
Talika has gone beyond the borders of traditional cosmetics and has adopted a unique creative process that revolves around three fundamental principles. Technological transfers that transfer life’s vital energy to the cells by creating new beauty techniques that go beyond the realms of typical cosmetic brands.
The brand’s current CEO, Alexis de Brosses, is no danger to explore the four corners of the globe in search of inspiration for Talika products. Whether it’s ancestral rituals or the latest NASA discovery, the world around us feeds into the development of Talika’s product range, which always appears to be at least one step ahead of the industry in terms of innovation. Talika’s goal is to take a 360-degree approach to beauty.

‍
The leading product range within the Talika brand remains its eye contour care. These eyebrow and eyelash products are designed to treat short, brittle, and sparse eyelashes and bring them back to life, along with under-eye puffiness, wrinkles, and dark circles.
Talika has now moved beyond its original roots as an eyelash and eyebrow brand to include a full skincare range that continues the philosophy of the Talika brand. Their skincare range has been adapted to meet all your skin needs. You’ll discover daily care products that are infused with hydrating ingredients and targeted formulas. Some of the most popular products within Talika’s skincare range include the Pink Clay Mask, Vegetal Gold Mask, and the new bio-cellulose mask.

‍
The Genius Light LED mask is amongst one of Tailka’s most exciting products and is the ultimate in wearable technology to help rejuvenate, de-stress, and soothe your skin in under 2 minutes. You can kickstart your skin in less time than it takes to make your morning coffee.
While the legendary eyelash conditioning cream hit the market in 1948, ti would take until 1994 for it to be redesigned. The legendary Lipocils gel formula hit the shelves in 1995, followed by the Lipocils Expert Enriched Legendary Formula in 2010. This newer version of the eyelash growth serums focused on pigmentation, helping curls to form with a specialist applicator.
In 2012, the Lipocils and Black lash serum and mascara duo hit the market, following in 2016 by the Lipocils Platinum Double-Serum for daytime and night-time use. It’s the perfect add-on to your skincare routine and helps promote lash growth and overall health. 2018 and 2020 saw the releases of special edition collectors edition of the Lipocils Expert product.

Talika Today

‍
Talika has now been taken over by Alexis de Brosses, who is overseeing the currently growth of the brand. The brand’s products continued to be inspired by natural biological mechanisms, while being respectful of the physiological balances that are essential for achieving healthy skin. Every Talika product contains a powerful blend of natural active ingredients that work to boost original cellular functioning.
Alexis de Brosses has described how “every product…is a small revolution”. It’s clear that de Brosses’ love for travel has influenced the future of Talika, whose light-based device has seen them grow closer links with NASA. Alexis sees Tailka is a blend of technology, science, and discovery.
You might be wondering what’s next to Talika? The brand is currently working on its next set of innovative devices, which they plan to release over the coming years. Talika is now available in 60 countries, but the brand remains one of the best kept secrets of Parisian beauty.
Today, Talika carries the tagline of ‘French beauty at its finest’ and starts that they have been a ‘lash and eye care experts since 1948’. Alexis de Brosses has said that every Talika product is a ”living entity that has a date of birth, a reason for being, and a destiny”. These products are born from the romance between nature and the brand’s researcher, with every creation being the outcome of an innovative creative process.
Alexis de Brosses also explores how Talika is more than just a brand, but is a destiny instead. Talika now sits in a comfortable spot between a drugstore and luxury brand, offering a more attainable price tag on some of its most innovative products. As a beauty brand powered by natural ingredients, Talika is up-front and transparent about the ingredients that they use in their products. You can check out the full list of Talika ingredients here.

‍
The purpose of Talika is to help you embrace your natural beauty. We’re excited to see where this innovative natural beauty brand goes next. It’s a tale of how some beauty brands grow from a simple but innovative product that makes a radical difference to your life. Talika’s next-generation products focus on the four most critical and visible areas of your skin: face hands, body, and eyes.
Every Talika product is specially designed with natural ingredients to give you visible results without relying on a chemical formula. Talika is a brand that listens to women and opens a two-way dialogue. Talika has grown and develop with one in the nearby area, creating the products that the modern woman needs before realising that they need it.
Talika’s products exist to treat the everyday skincare concerns of women; whether it’s your eyelash growth, dark circles under your eyes or even dark spots and wrinkles. The next time someone wants skin care advice, just point them directly towards Talika.

‍
What do you think of Talika? Have you ever heard of this Parisian skincare secret? Let us know in the comments below!

‍

We’re pulling back the curtain and introducing you to the Talika brand and showing you what makes it special. Our guide looks at the history of the brand and the journey that has made Talika the company it is today.

body:
It’s time to sit down and grab a mug of tea or an iced coffee. We want to introduce you to one of our favourite skincare brands of all time. This French made brand is one of the most innovative on the market and is our go-to for creating a new skincare routine. The House of Patyka is a Parisian beauty brand with an almost unrivalled history. It dates back to the 1920s before evolving into the organic cosmetic brand that we know and love today.

In 2002, Patyka became one of the first cosmetic brands to be certified organic by the ECOCERT label and offers a unique vision on the idea of beauty. It uses unique fragrances and textures to create one-of-a-kind products that you can’t find anywhere else.
We’re taking a deep dive into the world of Patyka to open up the curtains and show you what makes this Parisian brand so unique. We count it amongst our favourites and want to introduce you to one of Paris’ best-kept beauty secrets.

The History of Patyka

‍
During the roaring twenties, a Parisian apothecary formulate an elixir made of essential and vegetable oils that became the go-to scent and beauty secret for every Parisian woman. The Huile Absolue became an instant classic upon its release. The formula for Huile Absolute was rediscovered several decadaes later, giving birth to the Patyka, a Parisian organic cosmetic brand that takes its name from the ancient Greek word ‘apotheke’, meaning pharmacy.

‍
Since its launch Patyka has been on a mission to continue cultivating its heritage and developing their expertise within the green chemistry and biotechnology industry. Patyka is a beauty brand for the next generation by the next generation.

‍
Every Patyka product is certified as 100% vegan, without any of the usual real diary alternatives. Most vegan alternatives are made using the brnad’s Hydra-Soothing Cream or Universal Texture Smoothing Antioxidant Cream, as both contain bessewax.

‍
Patyka is a brand that demands excellence in its products. The Parisian beauty brand was launched in France, where they have their headquarters. Patyka offers products that are 100% exclusively made in France. The brand works in partnership with the best available producers to harvest botanical actives in the best quality and with the classic French artisanship and manufacturing as before.

The Values of Patyka

‍
Patkya’s values revolve around ethics, efficiency, excellence, and sensorially. They believe that these values are inseparable, and part of their mission to revolutionise the cosmetic industry by creating a unique vision of beauty.

‍
The brand is ECOCERT certified organic, meaning that every product meets the strict sets of rule s set out in order to get the organic rating. These regulations are set out by an independent body. This early certificate makes Patyka one of the first cosmetic brands in the world to be awarded the ECOCERT award.
Every Patyka product is made in France, including the packaging, using the finest craftsmanship. The packaging is shaped like an origam and is made in Burgundy. Patyka works with a group of partners that have been hand-selected to help them provide advice to future employees and trainees alike. Even if you’re a lont-erm healthcare worker, these presentations might teach you something you didn’t already know.

‍
Patyka products are also cruelty-free as they are not sold in China and nothing from the ingredients to the finished product is tested on animals. This cruelty-free commitment is at the heart of what Patyka is at the heart of everything Patyka does.

Sensoriality

‍
Part of Patyka’s philosophy is that you shouldn’t have to choose between ethics, efficiency, and sensorially. The aim of every Patyka product is to bridge the gap between these three things. The fragrance and texture in every Patyka product reflect the unique expertise of the team around the leaders of Patyka. The formulas are delicate and refined without being overpowering and are made in collaborating with one of the great craftsmen of France.

‍
The fragrances used as part of the Patyka range are 100% natural and custom-made in Grasse. Each authentic fragrance is compromised of raw materials and rigorously sweet yet subtle fruity taste. What makes Payuka uniwue Is that they’re a beauty product that is a true accomplishment for efficiency, using a unique application process for maximum pleasure.

Biotechnology and Creating Formulas

‍
Innovative biotechnology sits at the heart of Patyka’s product range, with every product containing a specialist laboratory formula that utilises the latest in sience and high technology development. They’re packed full of biological active ingredients that formula beatable skincare products.

‍
The Patyka skincare products have a proven track record with 18 years of scientific research backing up their development. Patyka’s advanced research means that it is able to develop its expertise within the green chemical and biotechnology industry to create products with proven efficacy.

‍
Patyka creates their products by first reflecting on the new formula. They engage their dermatological experts and combine it with their constant addition to create a product that meets your skin’s needs. The team start by imagining the formula before they start working on the texture, benefits, and perfume.

‍
Part of Patyka’s work is research and development into the effectiveness of formulas based on their biotechnological and biological active ingredients, which are each carefully selected. At the Patyka laboratory, the team seek to create the best formula that combines efficiency with sensorially. The brand promises to deliver an uncompromising high-quality formula every time.

‍
When the team has dreamed up the perfect formula and it has been validated, the team quickly get to work with testing the preservation, tolerance, and stability of the formula. These tests are part of the process by which Patyka is able to determine the safety of the formula.
Before the team can go any further, clinical studies by an independent organization have to be carried out to assess the satisfaction of the testers and to use instrumental measurements to measure the action of the product on human skin.
At the heart of every formula is a designer to create more effective formulas than conventional cosmetics brands with natural active ingredients that are a higher-quality and in a better quantity than synthetic ingredients.

The Composition of the Cares Patyka

‍
With all the certified organic formulas, the ingredients have to provide a beneficial action for your skin. The formulas are made using state of the art biotechnological assets. These molecules have a particular action that they carry out, whether it’s for anti-aging or to hydrate the skin.
The challenge that brands like Patyka face is to develop organic manufacturing processes, such as ecological extraction techniques that use living micro-organisation, such as yeast and bacteria, instead of traditional techniques of using chemical solvents.

‍
All the active ingredients within these formulas are from organically grown plants – because nature is their number one source of inspiration. The natural ingredients are better assimilated into the skin due to the biological relationship between the plant and epidermis of the skin.
Patyka creates partnerships with agricultural cooperatives to ensure the highest quality of production and the use of 100% natural preservatives and fragrance.
It’s time to say goodbye to normal water and opt for floral water in our products. The water in all Patyka products is being replaced by an exceptional substance that provides similar trends for you to check out.

‍
Damask rose floral oil combines the plumping serum fundamental which hydrates your skin, while delivering natural antioxidants and regenerating viruses. It’s the perfect skincare product for those who don’t know where to start. This product is synergised with biotechnology active ingredients in the formula.
Replacing traditional water with floral waters means that you can still take advantage of the exceptional properties of this product. Damask Rose Floral Water nourishes your skin, while Barley acts as an antioxidant and soothes your skin. Seeet mint is refreshing and invigorating but has become a zombie over recent months.
Like most certified organic skincare, biotechnology sits at its heard and works by combining the best of the pack with innovative ingredients that make you bring your selfies to life.
After 18 years of scientific research, the Patyka Advanced Research delivers clinically proven results that make a noticeable difference for your skin. Patyka is 100% clean skin care.
Almost every product is:

‍
• Silicone, parabens, polymers, waxes, and mineral oil free.
• Features no synthetic additives, dyes, fragrances, or preservatives.
• Contains no plant ingredients grown with pesticides.
• Has no ingredients of animal origin (with the exception of the Hydra-Soothing Cream, the Intensive Hydra-Soothing Cream, and the Antioxidant Smoothing Cream.

‍
Patyka is committed to protecting the environment with organic, made in France skincare that is also vegan. These 100% certified organic skincare products focus on stability and are made with the environment in mind. Patyka’s entire manufacturing process is certified as non-polluting, thanks to environmentally friendly extraction processes. The brand’s packaging is entirely sustainable, with carboard boxes, glass bottles, and recycled or recyclable plastic packaging.

‍
What do you think of Patyka? Is it a brand that you want to try out? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
brand-summary: It’s time to sit down and grab a mug of tea or an iced coffee. We want to introduce you to one of our favourite skincare brands of all time. This French made brand is one of the most innovative on the market and is our go-to for creating a new skincare routine. The House of Patyka is a Parisian beauty brand with an almost unrivalled history. It dates back to the 1920s before evolving into the organic cosmetic brand that we know and love today.
meta-description: We’re taking a deep dive into the world of Patyka to open up the curtains and show you what makes this Parisian brand so unique.
meta-title: Everything You Need to know About Patyka
name: Patyka

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
body:
NUXE is one of our favourite French brands and one that we’re excited to be spotlighting on our blog. This brand has grown from its humble beginnings in France to become one of the most famous beauty brands in the world. We’re taking a deep dive look at the history, commitments, and ingredients behind the success of this brand. We’ll also include product recommendations so that you can get to know Nuxe and understand the hype behind the brand.
This guide takes an in-depth look at NUXE, including its founder, Aliza Jabes. Our goal is to look beyond the hype to see what makes this brand tick and why it deserves to be in your skincare routine.

The History of NUXE

‍
NUXE began in a small formulation elaborate in Paris in 1990. In just thirty years, NUXE has become a globally recognised brand with a presence in over 60 countries. This French brand was founded by Aliza Jabes and is a pioneer within the natural beauty industry.  Every NUXE product is formulated and made in France, combining the highest-quality pharmaceutical ingredients with the innovative power of science.
The goal of NUXE founder Aliza Jabes has always been to create a daily skincare routine that works for all women. The brand launched its legendary Huile Prodigieuse product in 1991, followed by its Reve de Meiil lip balm, Crème Fraiche de Beaute, and their anti-ageing skincare collection. NUXE prides itself on offering something for every woman – whatever her age or skincare concerns.
NUXE has gone beyond being just a skincare brand. Aliza Jabes wanted to take the brand further and find a way to offer women a self-care experience in an intimate and comfortable setting. In 2002, NUXE opened its first Parisian spa on the Rue Montourgueil, which has now expanded to a network of over 50 spas throughout the world.

Meet Aliza Jabes

‍
A brand is nothing without its founder. Aliza Jabes is the woman behind the legend of NUXE. She’s a graduate of Science Pro Paris and has an MBA in Marketing and Finance. Her passion for beauty started in her childhood, encouraged by her father who was a researcher in the pharmacy industry.
During the early 1990s, she discovered a Research Development lab in Paris that would become the birthplace of the iconic NUXE brand. She focused on ultra-sensory natural-origin ingredients to create her innovative products. She took the brave leap of offering her products to pharmacies, when it was traditionally only dermatological skincare brands being offered within this niche.
The decision to bring NUXE to pharmacies was a deliberate one, allowing the brand to target its ideal demographic of women who wanted natural and ultra-effective skincare products with a sensual twist.
NUXE became a brand beloved by women across France, finding itself one of the leaders within the French beauty industry and offered in pharmacies across the country.
Aliza has continued to push the brand over the year, taking the decision to enter the spa industry with the infamous NUXE spas. The first one is located in an old 17th-century wine cellar, located in the heart of Paris.
Her entrepreneurial spirit and success has been recognised by several leading awards, including the Ernst & Young Prize for Entrepreneur of the Year in 2010, the CEW Achiever Award in 2012, and the Havas International Trophee Feeme en Or in 2014.

The Vision Behind NUXE

‍
The mission of NUXE is to create a remarkable beauty experience for every customer. The brand’s vision involves combining sensory awakening with nature and the power of science. NUXE is famous for their effective skincare products that take their inspiration from the world around us.
What makes NUXE stand out from the crowd is their natural-origin formulas and intoxicating scents that linger on your skin. NUXE’s vision is to make beauty and skincare accessible for all women.

The NUXE Laboratory

‍
Part of NUXE’s appeal is the fact that the brand makes their own skincare products in their dedicated laboratory. The NUXE laboratory is located in Paris and powered by the innovative ideas of the NUXE team and their nature-inspired formulas.
The laboratory focuses on using the most effective active ingredients to regenerate your skin with natural ingredients that are rare within the industry. NUXE has filed more than 40 patents within France, ranking it amongst the most innovative companies within France. Every NUXE product goes through strict testing to meet the brand’s commitment to providing the highest-quality products.
Nature is at the heart of every NUXE formula. They use nature as the source of inspiration, providing the energy behind the research carried out at their research laboratory. These active ingredients include some of the most active molecules available on the market, alongside natural origin ingredients that are formulated through an environmentally friendly process.
None of the products offered by NUXE contain synthetic ingredients, such as parabens or synthetic colorants, along with animal-derived ingredients. NUXE’s work is inspired by the idea of creating a sensory appeal and emotion that connects the customer with the product in a unique way.
As NUXE formulate their own products in their laboratory, they follow a strict validation protocol when creating their products. All NUXE products comply with European regulations, which are the most stringent in the world. The NUXE team of specialists perform strict control tests of every raw material, evaluating every ingredient against the brand’s natural formulation charter before approving its use.
As part of NUXE’s quality control measures, they guarantee a lifespan of over 30 months for every product, with a use period of between 6 to 12 months after opening. Every product is made on site in Lecousse in NUXE’s recently renovated factory that includes both microbiology and physical chemistry control laboratories.

The Commitments of NUXE

‍
NUXE is committed to protecting nature and conserving natural resources. Their approach is to take each step of the design process, from selecting natural ingredients to the packaging and formulation.
The brand focuses on having a fully traceable system for all active ingredients. They are committed to prioritising crops over wild harvesting and do not use CITES regulated materials, such as protected plant species.
They see it as their responsibility to create formulas that protect the environment. NUXE’s rinse-off formulas are over 80% biodegradable, limiting the environmental impact of NUXE products. The brand does not use microbeads in their exfoliator and instead chooses natural origin exfoliant particles.
Their products are kind to both your skin and animals, with vegan formulas that do not contain animal derived ingredients. This cruelty-free brand complies with European cosmetic regulations and incorporates environmentally responsible packaging, including the brand’s exclusive eco-designed jars that are made using recycled materials.
In 2018, research carried out found that their eco-designed 50-ml glass years yearly save the same resources as the water consumption of a single French adult over two-years, the destruction of 244 trees, and the emission of a car travelling the world 28 times.

NUEX’S Most Famous Product

‍
The product that made NUEX what it is today is the Huile Prodigieuse. This product is so popular that one bottle of Huile Prodigieuse is estimated to be sold every 11 seconds across the world. It was the brainchild of Aliza Jabes, when she was expecting her first baby and searching for a natural moisturizer that was multi-purpose and fit her changing lifestyle.
What makes the Huile Prodigieuse so popular is that the formula is 98% natural-origin, with a unique dry texture that rapidly absorbs into your skin without leaving any residue behind. It contains a blend of botanical oils, including the infamous argan and camellia oil, which nourish and repair your skin. You can also use this product on your body and hair to restore its natural shine.
The collection of Huile Prodigieus products has expanded to include several other formulas, including Huile Prodigieus Riche in 2016. It incorporates macadamia oil and is specially formulated for very dry skin. The latest product in the collection, Huile Prodigieuse Florale gives you all the benefits of the OG product with a citrus and white floral scent.

Proudly ‘Made in Franace’

‍
Part of what has made NUXE so popular is that the products are made in France including high-quality skincare ingredients. The research and development team behing NUXE is full of talented researchers who are experts in their field. Quality and innovation sit at the heart of everything NUXE does, allowing them to become part of France’s pharmacy heritage.
Along with the products being formulated in NUXE’s laboratories, they are supervised by independent laboratories that are approved by the French Ministry of Research. Every NUXE product is made in France at Lecousse, Brittany. The laboratory employs over 70 staff and has its own physiochemistry and microbiology laboratory.
Part of NUXE’s social commitments include protecting bees to help maintain our biodiversity. Water is one of the main ingredients in the NUXE formulas, and is why the brand supports the 1001 fountains NGO to help fund the installation of water production stations in developing countries.

‍
Is NUXE a skincare brand that you use? Are you a fan of natural skincare? Let us know in the products below!

‍

This brand has grown from its humble beginnings in France to become one of the most famous beauty brands in the world. We’re taking a deep dive look at the history, commitments, and ingredients behind the success of this brand. We’ll also include product recommendations so that you can get to know Nuxe and understand the hype behind the brand.
