author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
body:
Clarins is one of the most famous beauty brands in the world. It’s considered the number one prestige skin care brand in Europe account to NPD beauty trends. What we love about Clarins is its commitment to high-quality events, It’s a brand that has the royal stamp of approval after the Duchess of Cambridge was photographed carrying one of their lip products at Wimbledon.
We’re taking a deep dive into the world of Clarins Skincare to see what makes it so popular. We’re going to look at the different ingredients, the research and development behind the products, and how Clarins skincare became a household name. Whatever your skincare needs are, you can be guaranteed that Clarins has a product or range for you.
Grab a pen or bookmark this page to make it easy to find the perfect skincare products for you.

‍

The History of Clarins

‍
Clarins is a beauty brand that proudly carries the ‘made in France’ tagline. It was launched on March 15 1954 by Jacques Courtin-Clarins when he opened his first Clarins Institute, focused on the belief that your physical well-being and happiness are linked to your beauty.  Clarins came to the market at the same time as celebrities began to appear on the cover of magazines.

‍
Clarin’s first landmark product, the Body Shaping Cream, hit the market in 1962, streamlining contours and shapes of the body to eliminate cellulite. In 1968, Clarins made the decision to add customer cards inside the packaging upon the suggestion of employees.
What is extraordinary is that Jacques Courtin-Clarins was a medical student when he founded Clarins. He was actively involved with Clarins until his death in 2007, with his son Christian taking over as chairman of Clarins in 2000.

‍
As a French skincare brand, Clarins was greeted with almost immediate success. The mission of Clarins has always been to listen to the needs of women and create safe and natural skin care products that are highly effective. Clarins joined the Paris Stock Exchange in 1984, showing just how successful the brand had become.
What made Clarins an overnight success is that it was the fist brand to release face and body treatments that include formulas made exclusively of plant. It was sin the 1970s that Clarins began to gain its global recognition, entering stories in the Untied States and abroad.

‍
In 1990, Clarins was named as the No.1 high-end face skincare treatment brand in Europe, a title that it retains till this day. The first makeup products by Clarins hit the market in 1991, carrying the tagline of ‘Clarins, it’s all about you’. At the same time, Clarins also released their first anti-pollution product range to meet the needs of the modern consumer.
The 1990s saw Clarins acquire a stake in Thierry Mugler Couture, leading to the creation of Thierry Mugler parfums, which also launched the Clarins Group. The collaboration with Thierry Mugler led to the creation of the infamous Angel fragrance that remains a best-selling today.

‍
After the original beauty institute in Paris, it’s no surprise that Clarins was quick to establish a network of international Clarins Skin Spas across the world. These spas exclusively use Clarins products, with every spa experience including the customer learning more about how to protect their skin.
Fast forward to today and Clarins – otherwise known as Clarins group – is one of the most recognisable luxury beauty brands in France and across the world. Their product range has expanded to include everything from cosmetics to perfume and skincare.

‍
The brand is also the founder of the Courtin Arthritis Foundation, which launched in 1989 and made it possible for the brand to carry out extensive research on chronic inflammatory rheumatism and polyarthritis. The foundation is viewed as being responsible for most of the major advances made in rheumatoid arthritis research.

‍

10 Reasons why Clarins is the Most Trusted Skincare Brand

‍
In 2016, Clarins was named the No. 1 prestige skin care brand in Europe, reflecting the brand’s status as an attainable luxury skincare company that helps you achieve scientifically backed results.

‍
The holistic vision of Jacques Courtin-Clarins, the brand’s founder, remains at the heart of everything the brand does. What makes Clarins so special is that the brand played a role in the physical and mental liberation of women during the 50s and 60s in France.
Although Clarins has grown from its early days as a French brand to become one of the most recognised in the world, their products as still made and designed in France, remaining truthful to the original philosophy of the brand.

‍
While other skincare brands have been purchased by conglomerates, Clarins remains within the family of its original founder Jacques Courtin-Clarins. Oliver Courtin-Clarins is the Managing Director of the Clarins Group, while Christian Courtin-Clarins is the President of the Clarins Group Supervisory Board. Other members of the family including Claire Courtin-Clarins, Prisca Courtin-Clarins, and Virginie Courtin-Clarins all act as brand ambassadors for Clarins.
The family offered $3.6 million dollar to buy out the minority stakeholders from the Disney company. The brand intended to use the damages as a way of establishing a cosmetic company without the bad publicity that comes with a non-eco friendly brand.

‍
The popularity of Clarins comes from its natural ingredients, which deliver the same level of effectiveness as chemical ingredients. Clarins is known for using over 250 different natural plant extracts in their formulas. Every natural ingredient is carefully chosen to give ultimate effectiveness to the product and to optimise the formula to help you unlock your every beauty. Every product within the Clarins production process is sourced with the utmost care for the world around us and our biodiversity.
At the heart of Clarins is its dedication to permanent innovation. All you have to do is look at the brand’s serums over the years to see Clarins’ innovation. What makes Clarins so powerful is that it represents the meeting of the beauty needs and skincare requirements of women everywhere. The goal of Clarins products is to continue perfecting what already exists, such as your natural features.

‍

‍
Clarins is an industry leader and continues to dominate the market with their problem-solving products, different textures, and their application process that can help boost their efficiency.

‍
One reason why we choose to shop at Clarins is that they offer customised consultations. We’ve all struggled to find a skincare product that addresses our specific concern or the find the right foundation colour. Whatever your beauty concerns are, Clarins are here to help. They will help you establish a customised skincare routine that is made easy to follow with a personalised skin care program.
Community is at the heart of what Clarins does and follows on from their commitment to make life more beautiful. It is Clarins’ mission to respect nature and provide a way of protecting biodiversity. They support the local communities in these extraction areas and purchase their raw materials in accordance with fair trade regulations.  Clarins sees their consumer as a customer and ‘global citizen’, with a responsibility to respect our current and future generations.
Every Clarins product has a secret ingredient – Love. The heart-warming story behind Jacques Courtin-Clarins’ journey to creating the Clarins brand is heart-warming. It’s a sign of how an idea can spark into something so much more. Clarins has established relationships with their clients for over 60 years, providing customer service, research and development scientists, alongside marketers. The Clarins tea is wide, variety, and packed-full of love to support your skin and body.
Clarins is more than a job, it’s a passion and state of mind.

‍

Clarins Group

‍
Clarins is more than just an independent brand, it’s grown to become a conglomerate in tis own right. Other brands within he Clarins portfolio include Clarins and My Blend. The Group also oversaw the release of Clarins’ men’s range, entitled ‘Clarins Men’ in 2002. The division within the group known as the Clarins Fragrance Division has held the perfume portfolio of everyone from David Yurman to MUGGLER and Swarovski.

‍
In 2008 Christian and Olivier Courtin-Clarins initiated a takeover bid of the Clarins Group in order to maintain its independence and to take back control of the company’s sustainability initiative. The Clarins Group was delisted from the Paris Stock Exchange as a result. Two years later, the daughters of Christian and Olivier Courtin-Clarins – Virginie, Claire, Prisca, and Jenna – joined the Supervisory Board, continuing the family tradition at the heart of Clarins.
In 2014, Clarins unveiled their new building in the 17th arrondissement of Paris that will serve as the company’s new headquarters. In 2018, Clarins created the Clarins Domain at the heart of a preserved area in the Alps.

‍
Last year, Clarins handed its Mugler and Azzaro portfolio over to L’Oreal to allow the Clarins group to focus on their beauty products, Clarins, and the MyBlend range.

‍
Have you ever tried Clarins skincare product? Which one is you go-to or holy frail product? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
brand-summary: Clarins is one of the most famous beauty brands in the world. It’s considered the number one prestige skin care brand in Europe account to NPD beauty trends. What we love about Clarins is its commitment to high-quality events, It’s a brand that has the royal stamp of approval after the Duchess of Cambridge was photographed carrying one of their lip products at Wimbledon.
meta-description: Clarins is one of the most famous beauty brands in the world. It’s considered the number one prestige skin care brand in Europe account to NPD beauty trends.
meta-title: Everything You Need to Know About Clarins Skincare

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
body:
We want to introduce you to one of our favourite up-and-coming brands, Bronzette. This brand is inspired by the wild and rebellious women who are both chic and timeless. It’s the brand for the woman who isn’t afraid to show off some skin, wear a man’s shirt, and stick on her sunglasses without a care in the world. If ‘rebel chic’ sounds like your aesthetic, you’ve found your perfect match with Bronzette.
The brand takes its inspiration from the carefree girl who dances the night away and wakes up to the sound of cicadas. Whether you’re an Instagram model or someone who likes to read their horoscope, Bronzette exists to help you unlock your mischievous side.
We’re taking a deep dive into Bronzette to show you why it’s one of our new favourite brands. You’ll find out everything you need to know about this innovative beauty brand and get product recommendations along the way.

The History of Brunette

‍
Bronzette exists to give you the feel of summer all year long. Do you wish that summer could last forever? With Bronzette, you get to keep a piece of summer with you wherever you go. This vegan-friendly and cruelty-free brand is quickly becoming one of our favourites.
Their products are inspired by the tonka bean, a mythical essence distilled in Vallauris, known as the valley of perfumers in France. The brand has been recognised as bioethical, green, and natural by Yuka, thanks to their 100% vegan formulas.
Bronzette is a next-generation beauty brand that has sustainability at its heart, incorporating recyclable glass bottles to reduce waste with their packaging.
Bronzette’s key two key products – the Expert and Divine oils – carry the brand’s signature scent. The Bronzette fragrance encapsulates the idea of sensuality, carrying spicy top notes that make you picture summers spent sitting on the beach. The sensual heart notes of almond, cinnamon, and tiare flower add a captivating centre to the scent. What makes the aroma intoxicating is the woody notes of white musk, blended with the sweetness of vanilla.
The Bronzette scent is a unisex fragrance which is illusive and seductive, acting like a magnet to those around you.

Our Favourite Bronzette Products

‍
Our stand-out favourite product is the Perfect Bronzette Duo, which serves as the perfect introduce to the brand. This set includes the summer duo that you need in your life. The SPF30 Sun Oil and Multifunctional Dry Oil are our go-to all summer long. You don’t have to worry about using them in moderation, they’re perfect for lathering over your skin before hitting to the beach or arriving on the dance floor.
You can apply both these products to your body, hair, and face twice a day. They’re staples on our vanity table and two products that we reach for every day during spring and summer – or when we jet off on a tropical vacation.
Let’s take a deep dive into these two products, so you can understand what makes them so special.

Expert Bronzette

‍
The ‘Expert Bronzette’ is one of the hero products by Bronzette and offers a high SPF30 protection. Keeping your skin safe from the sun is the secret to maintaining your youthful glow. This sun oil protects your skin from UVA and UVB rays to prevent premature aging, sunspots, sun burns, and sagging.
Along with protecting your skin, this product also hydrates and nourishes your skin using two natural oils. Sunflower oil is a natural antioxidant which helps to slow down the skin’s aging process, while grape seed oil works to hydrate and nourish your skin due to its high vitamin E concentration.
You get the sensuality and natural shine of the oil with the extra layer of protection for your skin. You can use it in partnership with your daily SPF or as a stand-alone product. It’s a must-have for throwing into your beach bag or carry on when going on vacation. No swimsuit look is complete without a layer of the Bronzette High Protection Sun Oil SPF30.
We swear by using this product before going out in the sun, whether it’s for a walk in the park or a trip to the pool. You want to be reapplying this sun oil every two hours, and again after you get out of the pool or finish working out.
You can apply the Expert Bronzette to your body, along with your face and hair for added UV protection. What we love about this product is that it will help protect your hair and skin from chlorine and salt, making it ideal for anyone who spends their summers at the beach. This product is safe for all skin types as it contains 100% vegan ingredients that are kind to your skin.

Divine Bronzette

‍
The sister product to the Expert Bronzette is the Divine Bronzette. You can use this product in partnership with the sun oil or as a stand-alone product.
There is nothing more sensual than soft and silky skin, with a sweet fragrance that lingers on the skin. That’s exactly what this product gives you.
Divine is an everyday essential is contains a blend of three natural oils. Grapeseed oil nourishes your skin with its rich vitamin E concentration, while sweet almond oil is packed-full of omega 9 to soothe sensitive skin. Argan oil – known as liquid gold – is a natural antioxidant that is perfect for protecting your hair from the sun and while in the water.
The innovative formula of this multifunctional oil means that it penetrates deeply into your skin and dries quickly without leaving a residue behind. You can also use this nourishing oil on your hair and nails as a sustainable treatment that leaves them soft to the touch and gently fragranced.

Winter Heat T-Shirt

‍
The concept of Bronzette is built on the idea of taking summer with you throughout the year, even into winter. The ‘winter heat’ t-shit is made using organic cotton and is created in a small workshop in Paris’ 2nd arrondissement. The t-shirt caries the slogan ‘Canicule Hivernale’, meaning winter heatwave in French.
The philosophy behind the t-shirt matches the mission of the brand. It’s founded on the idea of respecting our planet, it’s people and animals alike.

Why we love Bronzette

‍
Bronzette is more than just a tagline or a romanticisation of summer. What the brand offers is an innovative product range that cares for your skin while unlocking your inner sensuality – all while protecting our planet. For too long, we’ve had to settle for products packed full of chemicals that harm our skin and damage our ecosystems.
What makes Bronzette different is that their sun oils not only protect and nourish your skin, but they’re full of skin-loving natural ingredients. Their products are kind to both you and animals, with their cruelty-free 100% vegan formulas. Everything down to the packaging has been thought about, with all of Bronzette’s product range being cruelty-free.
Bronzette is right on trend and has its fingers on the pulse – in more ways than one. Everyone wants to achieve a healthy, dewy glow. We’ve become more educated on the dangers of the sun and know that we can’t sit outside working on our tan without wearing an SPF. You get the functionality of a sunscreen with nourishing ingredients that your skin will love. It’s all packed inside eco-friendly glass packaging that is made under the Provencal sun.
You can indulge in the latest skincare and beauty trends, all the while knowing that you’re helping to protect our planet. We can’t think of a better product range for Gen Z and Millennials who want to have a sustainable beauty routine without compromising on quality or style.
Bronzette’s ‘cheeky cosmetic treatments’ are eco-friendly, cruelty-free, vegan, and plastic-free. You can explore the full Bronzette product range and purchase your own sun oils here.

‍
Have you tried the Bronzette product range? We’d love to hear your thoughts about the brand in the comments below!

‍

It’s the brand for the woman who isn’t afraid to show off some skin, wear a man’s shirt, and stick on her sunglasses without a care in the world. If ‘rebel chic’ sounds like your aesthetic, you’ve found your perfect match with Bronzette.

body:
Meet Aysse. It’s a French skincare brand based in Champagne. It was founded in 2011 in Reims, France and is the brainchild of Pascale Baudin de Saint Quantin. She is the great-great-cousin of Josephine de Beaucharnais, the wife of Napoleon, who famously used to bathe in sparkling water. This mid-tier beauty brand provides attainable luxury to women who want to prevent premature ageing and unlike their skin’s inner radiance.
We’re taking a deep dive into the brand to find out everything we can about Aysse, their USP, and its unique active ingredient that you’re probably more used to drinking than putting on your face. Aysse is one of our favourite skincare brands, and one we’re excited to share with you in this ultimate brand guide.

What is Aysse?

‍
Aysse is a French skincare brand that focuses on the skincare benefits of champagne. It incorporates the antioxidants, minerals, and vitamins that come from champagne to boost your skin’s natural radiance and prevent premature aging. Aysse’s use of champagne is backed up by research from the University of Reims who found that champagne is an effective skincare ingredient.
What we love about Aysse is that it’s a hidden gem within the French skincare community. Unless you’ve got your ear to the ground, you might not have come across this inventive brand. Aysse sits at a mid-tier price tag, making its champagne-infused skincare products attainable to a wider range of customers.
The brand originally sold their skincare products across France and Italy before expanding to Asia and the Middle East. Aysse also opened its own three-storey flagship store in Paris, with its dedicated Champagne bar.
Aysse isn’t afraid to play on the connection between founder Pascale Baudin de Saint Quantin and the Napoleon family. Baudin found her love from skincare after spending time with her grandmother in France. She watched as the older woman blended her own products using sparkling wine, passing on her knowledge and passion to Baudin. Years later, Baudin took her grandmothers recipes and improved the formulations with the help of a dedicated team of scientist.
Champagne was to Josephine de Beauharnais what we think donkey milk may have been to Cleopatra; both infamous women of history are famous for their beauty tricks, most of which are still used today.
Aysse has two product ranges within their brand. ‘Millesime’ is dedicated towards young women under the age of 40, while the ‘Prestige’ collection is for women over the age of 40. Each collection includes dedicated products to address the specific skincare concerns of each demographic, including anti-aging and sun damage.
The products within Aysse’s collection feature 1-5% pure champagne, alongside 40 other active ingredients.

Aysse’s Product Range

‍
Part of Aysse’s facial skincare line includes the Serum Eclat Immediat, which works to revitalise your skin and boost its natural radiance. Millesime Prime Jeunesse is a moisturiser targeted at women under 40 who want to prevent premature aging, while the Prestige Temps Jeunesse is made with mature skin in mind. Their Eclat Regard is an eye product that everyone can benefit from using.
The brand offers three facial cleansers that allow you to perfect the art of double cleansing. The milky make-up remover is the gentlest option, followed by the purifying mousse and alcohol-free toner. Aysse also has two face masks, including Masque Tendre, which hydrates sensitive skin, and the Masque Gommage, which boosts your skin’s natural cellular renewal process.
Aysse also offers an extensive range of body care products to use alongside their skincare products. You can find everything from gently spray-on moisturizers to highly concentrated hydrating body lotions and a hand cream that easily absorbs into your skin to prevent premature aging and drying.
What makes the Aysse product range so unique is that almost every product contains a 5% concentration of champagne. Lionel De Benetti is responsible for formulating Aysse’s products and explains that champagne has over 1,000 different molecules which are ‘necessary for the vital function of the skin’. Champagne incorporates everything from copper, which protects your skin from free radical damage and zinc, which slows down aging and keeps the cellular turnover moving.
While wine is not a new ingredient within the skincare industry, champagne is in a league of its own. The rich mineral content of the clay and limestone soil that the three grapes grow in to make champagne gives the ingredients their higher concentration.

Why champagne?

‍
You might be wondering why someone would use champagne in their skincare products. After all, sparkling wine is a more common ingredient than champagne itself. What makes champagne different is that it is made using three types of grape – chardonnay, pinot noir, and pinot Meunier, while traditional wines are made using one type. The double fermentation process of making champagne allows the components to be further concentrated to give you the full-potential of the active ingredients.
On the back of every Aysse product, you’ll find the brand’s key statement. All their formulas contain what they describe as ‘Champenois vineyard extracts’, which are rich in antioxidant flaxonoids, organic acids, minerals, and vitamins. These active components work to restore your cellular metabolism and slow down the aging process to give you a youthful glow.
Brigette Bardot once said that,” champagne is one thing that gives me zest when I feel tired”. It’s a sentiment shared by the infamous Madame de Pompadour, who is quoted as having said that, “champagne is the only wine that leaves a woman beautiful after drinking it!”. We think they would be two of Aysse’s biggest fans!
The Aysse product range has been featured everywhere from Elle France to Vogue France and the Express. They’ve all raved about the power of Aysse’s champagne-fuelled skincare products.
What we love about Aysse is that its founder has taken her connection to one of France’s most famous women and used it to create an innovative skincare brand that we couldn’t feel but fall head over heels for. Who would have thought that champagne would feel as good on your skin as it tastes?

‍
Have you ever thought of using champagne as a skincare ingredient? What Aysse product are you planning on trying? Let us know in the comments below!

brand-summary: Meet Aysse. It’s a French skincare brand based in Champagne. It was founded in 2011 in Reims, France and is the brainchild of Pascale Baudin de Saint Quantin. She is the great-great-cousin of Josephine de Beaucharnais, the wife of Napoleon, who famously used to bathe in sparkling water. This mid-tier beauty brand provides attainable luxury to women who want to prevent premature ageing and unlike their skin’s inner radiance.
meta-description: We’re taking a deep dive into the brand to find out everything we can about Aysse, their USP, and its unique active ingredient.
